Job_Title: PhD Researcher - Doctoral Candidate for Urban Microalgae Protein (T150-0061)
Job_Descriptions: ETH Zurich is one of the leading universities of the world with a strong focus on science and engineering. In 2010 it established the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) in collaboration with the National Research Foundation (NRF) to do interdisciplinary research on pressing problems. The Singapore-ETH Centre is home to a community of doctoral, postdoctoral, and professorial researchers working in three main programmes: Future Cities Laboratory , Future Resilient Systems , and Future Health Technologies . The centre provides a multicultural and interdisciplinary environment to researchers working on diverse themes, with the shared vision of translating research to practical solutions for more sustainable and liveable cities, resilient physical and social urban systems, and patient-centric healthcare systems. In collaboration with the National University of Singapore (NUS) and A*STAR-SIFBI SEC is undertaking a research project on Urban Single-Cell Protein Production Harnessing Emerging Microalgae-based Up- and Downstream Concepts . It addresses some immanent food security associated challenges by developing an urban single-cell protein production and R&D platform that tackles the challenge of increasing Singapore's domestic food supply resulting from the quest for independence and a rapidly growing and steadily ageing population, covering the value-chain from primary production to food concept development. Project Background Singapore targets increasing its domestic, independent food supply under urbanized constraints by 30% until 2030. The project aims to enable independent, domestic, resilient, and urban food/protein supply by consumer relevant bright yellow heterotrophic microalgae biomass: 1) Establish a state-of-the-art urban single-cell protein production platform using food processing side-streams to leverage supply-chain sustainability and mitigate costs employing circular economy concepts. 2) Innovate supply-chain eco-efficiency by improving microalgae production efficiency and final product affordability through pulsed electric field processing. 3) Build an R&D platform for concrete food concept development of meat alternatives harnessing extrusion and 3D-printing for large-scale and decentralised food supply. 4) Understand the Singaporean consumers preferences and needs related to innovative microalgae-based food products. The project delivers affordable, palatable, and nutritious microalgae-based food products to the market. It strengthens Singapore's food security, provides strategic and economic benefits through stimulating economic productivity, and leverages global competitiveness on the meat alternative market. Job Description As a Doctoral Researcher you will be responsible for research that aims to develop, test, and validate a pulsed electric field (PEF)-based biorefinery concept to ameliorate single-cell value-chain efficiency. This work will be performed in collaboration with our research partners at the National University of Singapore (NUS) and A*STAR-SIFBI. Your tasks will include : - Research, develop, and optimize PEF protocols to maximise nutrition yields during and after microalgae cultivation - Designing, developing, and performing experiments to establish and validate a PEF-based biorefinery approach - Work collaboratively within a multinational team to advance microalgae up- and downstream activities in support of an innovative PEF platform - Independently conceive and execute experiments that implement PEF-based biorefinery concepts and test new techniques - Communicating research outcomes, e.g., at relevant international conferences and in peer-reviewed journals - Maintain effective communication within cross-functional team - Acting at the interface between science and technology when supervising students and collaborating with partners from academia and industry Requirements You will have: - A M.Sc. (or equivalent) in Food Science or Engineering, Biotechnology, Bioprocess Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related fields - Expertise and interest in working with biological systems (e.g., single cells such as bacteria or microalgae) and PEF processing - Experience with R, Python, or similar programming language - A strong interest in working with and developing new approaches for protein separation - Experience of working independently and collaborating in an international environment - Scientific curiosity and motivation to perform scientifically rigorous experimental work - Good people skills when interacting with colleagues and collaboration partners - Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English The following competences will be advantageous: - Experience working with microalgae - Experience in pulsed electric field processing - At least one peer-reviewed publication - Experience in protein separation Information about the application process and contact for applicants We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents: Cover letter outlining your motivation and experience in the field, CV including certificates (e.g. Master's and/or Bachelor's degree), and transcript of records. Specific research proposal (max. 3 pages) based on strong scientific references. Questions (not applications) regarding the position should be directed to Prof. Alexander Mathys ([HIDDEN TEXT]) Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. For further information about our research and projects, please visit www.sfp.ethz.ch. More information about the Urban Single-Cell Protein Production is available here: https://sec.ethz.ch/research/microalgae-based-food-concepts.html The Singapore-ETH-Centre is an equal opportunity and family-friendly employer. All candidates will be evaluated on their merits and qualifications, without regards to gender, race, age or religion.

Introduction Dense and Green Cities: Emerging Models of Integrated Urban Development at the Singapore-ETH Centre Future Cities Lab Global is looking for a Post-Doctoral Researcher to conduct and coordinate research on the systems performance dimensions of sustainable integrated districts with a focus on Singapore. Project background FCL Global is an international knowledge hub with the capabilities to conduct fully transdisciplinary and comparative research on the complex challenges of urbanisation. It builds upon Future Cities Laboratory, which, since 2010, within the frame of the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC), grew into one of the most impactful urban science research centres in the world. FCL Global innovates upon those foundations with the benefit of two distinctive regional perspectives: one from the tropics and another from temperate Europe, embedded at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich (ETHZ). Dense and Green Cities: Emerging Models of Integrated Urban Development explores the development of sustainable integrated districts (SIDs) as a model for high-density high-liveability future cities through a series of case studies with a focus on Singapore and Switzerland to allow for an evaluation, comparison, and learning on how SIDs are best planned and realised in various settlement systems. The project captures important aspects of the urban planning and design, architecture, social, environmental, economic, and governance systems performances of SIDs systematically through a number of work packages and an interdisciplinary team of researchers that consists of urban planners and designers, architects, engineers, and scientists. The research is conducted in close collaboration with important stakeholders from the industry as well as from government agencies in both Singapore and Switzerland as well as in a number of other international locations. Job description Lead the environmental performance assessment work package for buildings and urban systems at the district level. Develop physical-based models at the district level and evaluate the models via data-driven approaches to investigate thermal comfort and urban environment. Develop strategies for the improvement of the existing urban systems and the future urban development. Integrate the environmental performance assessment with a socio-spatial context. Coordinate the research with other work packages in Dense and Green Cities. Requirements Doctorate in Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Urban Planning, or a related field. Track record of excellence in engineering and building science. Familiar with whole building thermal modelling, building physics, and sustainable design. Previous experience in sensor-based experiment design and data collection. Python and R programming knowledge and experience in data science tools, data mining, machine learning algorithms. Previous experience in GIS. Ability to conduct independent research and survey activities. Information about the application process and contact for applicants We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents: Cover letter CV Educational certificates Further information about FCL Global can be found on our website: https://fcl.ethz.ch Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. Further information about the Singapore-ETH Centre can be found on our website www.sec.ethz.ch. The Singapore-ETH Centre is an equal opportunity and family-friendly employer. All candidates will be evaluated on their merits and qualifications, without regards to gender, race, age or religion.

Job_Title: Postdoctoral Researcher – Urban Data Analytics for Energy Demand Prediction (C3142)
Job_Descriptions: Introduction ETH Zurich is one of the leading universities of the world with a strong focus on science and engineering. In 2010 it established the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) in collaboration with the National Research Foundation (NRF) to do interdisciplinary research on pressing problems. The centre currently runs several research programmes with the Future Cities Laboratory (FCL) as one of the programmes. It is home to a community of over 100 PhD, postdoctoral and Professorial researchers working on diverse themes related to sustainable cities and resilient infrastructure systems. In the course of their work, researchers actively collaborate with universities, research institutes, industry, and government agencies with the aim of offering practical solutions. Project background The Future Cities Laboratory Global (FCL Global) in Singapore is looking for an exceptional candidate to fill a postdoctoral researcher position in the field of urban data analytics. The goal of the research is to harness large-scale human activity data for the planning of efficient and sustainable energy infrastructures in cities (distributed solar power generation, charging infrastructure for electric vehicles). The research is part of FCL Global's Powering the City project (https://fcl.ethz.ch/research/powering-the-city.html), and the initial appointment is for one year. Job Description Main tasks include: Analysis of big data with respect to human activity patterns in cities (e.g., daily population flows derived from anonymized and aggregated mobile phone data). Development of mathematical models for the prediction of local energy needs based on human activity patterns. Contribution to the design of the research project. Collaboration with both academic and industrial partners of the project. Co-authorship of scientific publications in leading peer-reviewed journals and/or top conferences. Requirements The ideal candidate should have: A PhD degree in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or equivalent A strong publication records Experience in the field of urban analytics and/or human mobility Practical skills in MATLAB, Python and/or R, as well as in the use of GIS tools Strong English communication skills Information about the application process and contact for applicants We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents: Cover letter that includes a statement of motivation (1.5 pages maximum) Curriculum vitae Publication list The applicant should be prepared to provide letters of recommendation or names/contacts of references upon request Further information about FCL Global can be found on our website: https://fcl.ethz.ch Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. Further information about the Singapore-ETH Centre can be found on our website www.sec.ethz.ch. The Singapore-ETH Centre is an equal opportunity and family-friendly employer. All candidates will be evaluated on their merits and qualifications, without regards to gender, race, age or religion.

A research engineer position is available at the Institute for Infocomm Research (I2R), A*STAR, Singapore. We are looking for strong candidates in the field of machine learning for accelerated materials discovery and fault detection in semiconductors, with Python implementation and data management skills. Successful applicant will work with a team to develop new machine learning algorithms for the AMDM project. They will also have opportunities to work with local and international collaborators in academia. Job Requirements Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in the field of computer science, computer engineering, mathematics and statistics, data science intensive programs, with expertise in one or more in the following areas: data mining and management, machine learning, deep learning, etc. 2 to 3 years working experience in related research areas is a plus Ability to work independently, as well as in teams, highly desired. Good communication skills for reports and publications. Proficiency in spoken and written English. Good knowledge on data analytics/machine learning/data mining, and experiences in solving real-world data science problems Proficient in Python (added skill in PyTorch, TensorFlow, Theano), R, C Prior experience with deep learning and reinforcement learning is a plus Ability to develop prototypes to demonstrate the feasibility of research ideas

We seek a passionate and committed candidate to work on the fabrication and development of quantum devices with the long-term goal of building a scalable and error free quantum computer and related quantum metrology. The design of relevant quantum devices and the development fabrication recipes for realising such devices will be a crucial area of research and development. This position resides in the Quantum Materials and Devices group at the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE), A*STAR. As part of our research team, you will contribute to the fabrication of devices and document process recipes for our research in quantum devices with the goal of building qubits in 2-dimensional (2D) material platforms. You will also participate in the measurement of the devices including setting up of measurement protocols, data collection and analysis. Main Responsibilities Design and fabrication of 2D material-based devices. Develop process fabrication and etching recipes. Contribute to device characterization and measurements. Provide technical documentation and manuscript writing. Contribute to or lead in grant writing depending on level of experience. Job Requirements PhD degree in physics, applied physics, materials science, electrical-electronics engineering, or related fields. Laboratory experience in materials processing and device fabrication. Well-versed in lithography and etching techniques. Experience with 2-dimensional materials strongly preferred. Ability to work unsupervised and collaboratively with a team. Resourceful in problem solving and critical thinking. Meticulous and analytical in experimental work. Good presentation skills (written and verbal). Good command of English.

We are seeking for an outstanding candidate to join in our project aimed at developing an innovative analytical platform combining optical microscopy, microfluidic devices and IR spectro-microscopy. The development of an optimized microfluidic set-up is one of a key elements of this interdisciplinary project. A new kind of such devices, compatible with both IR spectroscopy and optical microscopy, is required to allow for the observation of live biological samples (e.g. cells and tissues). Moreover, the microfluidic set-up need to be developed in junction with the optical system, which is based on and original approach using quantum correlation for the detection of IR signal (see A. Paterova et al., Hyperspectral infrared microscopy with visible light, Science Advances, 6 (4428), 2020). Suitable Candidates are expected to have experience in micro/nano fabrication processes, with hands-on practice in clean-room based technologies. Mask design and fabrication, UV lithography, dry etching and soft-lithographic procedures are among the required know-how. Knowledge of optical microscopy and some experience with building systems for setting-up experiments on a microscope is considered as a plus. Excellent communication skills and good team-work attitude are also required, writing scientific reports both for internal documentation and for publication is a component of this job position. Main Duties and responsibilities: Masks design and fabrication Devices microfabrication and characterization Microfluidic set-up and adaptors for biological samples microscopy Technical/Scientific reports writing and presentation Required know-how: Mask drawing software (L.-edit, Layout, AutoCAD) UV lithography Silicon dry/wet etching Soft lithography (e.g. PDMS casting) Minimum Qualifications: PhD degree in physics, engineering, material science or related disciplines, with minimum 1 year of cleanroom or microfabrication processes experience.

Job_Title: VP, Intelligent Bank Lead (Analytics), Consumer Banking Group (WD30136)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business they were made just right for you. Job Role The Intelligent Bank team is focused on defining and implementing what's next for DBS after digital, utilising our years of investment in digital capabilities, UX, and real-time customer data, with the objective of creating personalised, relevant, intuitive and meaningful experiences for our customers. We are focused on learning and understanding our customers needs, behaviours, motivations and emotions. We explore and discover through customer immersions, experimentation and data. Customer and data insights drives everything we do, from product strategy to design, implementation, go live, and driving results. We work in collaborative, cross-functional squads to solve problems practically, craft and build experiences that will wow our customers. Metrics and performance Understand data deeply: Identify and drive data analysis for planned features, use data to investigate problem areas and to identify scenarios or customer journeys which need to be designed for Use insights from data to design and prioritise new features Define and track performance metrics of new features Make data-based recommendations and solutions. Data drives decisions Be able to explain data to people less familiar with the data or application you are driving Delivery and execution Lead, enable and assist a country team (e.g. Indonesia or India) from concept to design, through to build and implementation of Intelligent Bank Closely following the progress of country teams, solve or escalate problems, issues, dependencies and manage to an execution plan Ensure country activities align with common regional objectives Develop and manage deep relationships with country teams. Influence and evolve understanding across the organisation on our views on Intelligent Bank Manage execution to timelines, including handling unexpected issues, engaging stakeholders in changes, and while defining future build for the next releases of Intelligent Bank in parallel Requirement Known for working well with a range of personalities, selfless, helpful, committed, reliable Experience working in complex strategic initiatives across various geographies. Capable of handling multiple streams of work in different stages (e.g. definition / design of future build in parallel to delivery of current plan and requirements) Execution focused: Prioritises, practical, knows key milestones, monitors delivery, issues, risks Ability to identify and pursue issues end to end until they are resolved Understands banking products and balances between benefit to the bank and benefit to the customer Ability to grasp complex technical and product concepts, with strong interpersonal skills, and ability to modify communication to listeners Analytical, fluent with data Team player, works well with others, manages stakeholders effectively Creative, intellectually curious, persistent and highly collaborative, with a passion A plus would be a history of building something new through challenges (e.g., building a business, of your own or within a company / department) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Associate, Data Scientist (NLP), Analytics Center of Excellence, Group Transformation (WD29773)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the World's Best Digital Bank (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Job Purpose Deliver data science analysis to support business decisions for various business and support units of the bank. Develop Advanced NLP components to be included in innovative applications by creating prototypes. Develop solutions based on advanced analytics, leveraging internal data sources and external data assets. Key Responsibilities Build machine learning solutions to solve various business questions. Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to big data Select features, build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques Perform data wrangling and feature engineering Data mining using state-of-the-art methods Extend company's data with third party sources of information when needed Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner Build NLP solutions Build end to end NLP solutions and prototypes for business problems Perform data cleansing and build data pipelines Develop traditional NLP models as baseline and compare with deep learning models wherever applicable Build solid evaluation framework for NLP models and able to identify where model fails and how can the solution be improved Develop bank NLP capabilities such as NLP python package and web UI for internal users Develop visualization interfaces that help business make more insightful decisions Maintain cutting edge in data science Take initiative in evaluating new approaches from data science research Test new tools, platforms and packages Support the programs for changing the business culture towards more data driven decision making Create helper functions to automate frequently encountered wrangling and feature engineering tasks Skills and Experience 3 years of industry experience in data science/machine learning projects working in a big data environment 2 years of industry experience working in NLP projects PhD/Masters/Bachelors in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or related majors. Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Random Forests, XgBoost etc. Familiar with sklearn Familiar with text processing tools like nltk, spacy, huggingface Familiar with NLP algorithms like topic modelling, sentiment analysis, Bert / Roberta and other deep learning models, text classification Familiar with NLP frameworks like tensorflow, keras, pytorch Experienced in building end to end NLP workflows from data acquisition, EDA, modelling, evaluation to deployment Experienced with NLP use-cases like chatbots, translation, search and recommendation Highly proficient with data wrangling and feature engineering Familiar with programming tools such as Spark, Python and SQL. Great communication and presentation skills Data-oriented personalityand able to multi-task Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Job_Title: Senior Manager, Integrated Supply Chain Security APAC
Job_Descriptions: Job Title Senior Manager, Integrated Supply Chain Security APAC Job Description Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow. But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most. The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs. In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better By playing a key role in securing the Philips goods flows, ensuring the supply chains are secure from unauthorized access through the entire process, from sourcing of materials through to final delivery to customer for the APAC region which includes Greater China and Indian Sub-Continent. The Senior Manager of Integrated Supply Chain works closely with other teams of Group Security, Global Supply Chain, Procurement, Finance and other relevant business partners. You will support Supply Chain business initiatives from a security standpoint and ensure supply chain security compliance with all relevant stakeholders for international and domestic flows. The role is expected to seek out and clearly communicate relevant data to support complex business decisions and drive the right recommendations in a compelling and effective way. You are responsible for Supply Chain Security Program Management for the APAC region, specifically the deployment of policies and standards across the end-to-end supply chain Supply Chain Security audits and assessments in the APAC region Management of the Supply Chain Security Awareness program in the APAC region Enhance, track and report on risk/threat metrics Ad-Interim Regional Security Manager for physical and personnel security in the APAC region; coordination of crisis management, personnel security and physical security To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following A strong background in Supply Chain Security or Warehousing / Logistics related topics, preferably with 12 - 15 years of experience in this space. Added Advantage; CTPAT / AEO / TAPA certified auditors and/or holistic knowledge of the end-to-end Supply Chain Goal driven, target oriented, able to step back and look at the bigger picture, you will also be able to manage ambiguity and possess a preparedness to get involved Ability to work in an ambiguous environment and drive continuous improvements in the process Ability to work with multiple stakeholder and Tech teams to get required technology developed to improve process efficiency Strong problem-solving skills and the abilities to analyze, scope requirements and effectively prioritize program deliverables are essential Excellent communication skills How we work at Philips There are three core ways that define our ways of working - embracing flexibility, being at our best, and impactful collaboration. We believe this enables us to deliver an outstanding experience to our customers and create the best place to work for people who share our passion. We know just how important direct interactions are and work is more engaging when we are more frequently face-to-face, and that we experience better collaboration which drives innovation. While we have many different types of roles across Philips most require a combination of in-person collaboration with colleagues and partners, usually at a Philips location, and individual focus time, which can be done remotely. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you. Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.

About Sleek Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms. We are a team of 200 builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients! We are looking for an amazingly well-rounded Product Manager to help make our customer products fantastic! As Product Manager Customer, you will be working to develop features end to end for the full suite of Sleek products used by our end customers. Sleek provides a variety of services to its start-up customers, and what matters to them is speed, convenience, & quality. They also expect great customer service, easy communication and even relevant recommendations on how to improve their business operations. You never compromise on quality. You seek to understand every detail so the end product delights customers, and the engineering team can build at pace. You are agile, able to adapt quickly, good-hearted and ambitious. You have a passion for entrepreneurs and start-ups. You are a JIRA ninja (or as close as anyone can really be..). Position Duties Managing all aspects of product development and user experience for existing and new products Think creatively and rigorously about how to solve problems and how we can add value to small business owners & start-up founders Identify market trends and customer needs to inform new products and features Enforce customer centricity in the product development cycle. Deduce insights for our product strategy based on data and user feedback. Drive discovery process, including inputs from research, design and internal stakeholders, to formulate product vision Prioritize roadmap based on customer and business impact Define and communicate product requirements and specifications, and be clear of the definition of done. Work closely with software development squad to ensure great quality and pace in delivery, and help manage scope to ensure progress. Requirements Performance Standards At least 3 years working experience as a Product Manager or System Analyst Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work collaboratively with others Excellent written and verbal communication skills Accounting experience a strong plus Proficient in Agile methodologies to build the product features & roadmap Proficient with JIRA Good enough understanding of the various technology stacks used for frontend as well as backend implementations. Accounting knowledge a plus WE LIKE CANDIDATES WHO Like ownership and being accountable for success Bring creative, out-of-the-box ideas Think big Ask the right questions to understand user problems and develop solutions. Have enough technical appetite to understand how our underlying products are built Have a keen eye for details Are ex-founders More about Sleek! At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 18 nationalities and spoken languages. We consider the company’s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Our corporate social responsibility is a passion we take very seriously as an opportunity to make the world a better place. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity. If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you! Benefits Performance Bonus Work From Home Flexi Health Care

Job_Title: Event Producer APAC - Cities Without Houses
Job_Descriptions: Who We Are… We are a collection of members' clubs, restaurants, hotels and cinemas, catering to those in the film, media, fashion and creative industries. The company has unique ventures throughout the UK, USA, Canada, Europe and Asia, with new openings planned globally. Soho House is a space for its diverse membership and teams to connect, grow, have fun and make an impact. Opportunities for all… Soho House was created to bring diverse communities of people together, and we take the same approach when building our teams. We thrive on differences and believe it is critical to our success as a global company. Soho House is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business. The Role… Soho House & Co are seeking an experienced events expert with a proven track record executing all aspects of events, from conception to completion. This full-time regional Event Producer role reports to the Head of Membership, Cities Without Houses, Asia Pacific and is part of a team that identifies, creates and produces aspirational out-of-house events in Asia Pacific that connects and grows our creative community. The role will be responsible for the execution all Cities Without Houses events programmed for this region; including socials/parties, dinners, day trips, workshops, talks, music events, as well as third-party events with partners. This position will be responsible for managing and executing high quality events, including client and partner liaison, and all event production, logistics and budgets across key markets in Asia Pacific including Singapore, Tokyo, Shanghai, Sydney. Main Duties… Manage and oversee the execution of a range of events taking place concurrently across Asia-Pacific outside of existing Soho House clubs Work closely with membership team on event programming for all key cities Build relationships with hospitality partners, venues, event stylists, talent and a wide range of operations staff. You will work effectively with these vendors to facilitate their delivery of the events onsite to the highest standard, ensuring site deadlines are met and teams are working in an efficient manner Build a solid understanding of staffing requirements for events to ensure adequate staffing levels for all events ahead of time Draft realistic budgets and deliver events in line with these, communicating all financial details to the Head of Membership, APAC in a timely manner and ensuring budgets are correctly reconciled post event Problem solve on a live event and deal with challenging logistical situations A strong understanding of site health and safety and compliance in each city Conduct venue searches, site visits, supplier meetings and debriefs (dependent on the current travel restrictions). Alternatively, ability to set SOPs to local team members to conduct the prior. Manage performers & talent riders & requests (dependent on the current travel restrictions). Alternatively, ability to set SOPs to local team members to conduct the prior. Manage multiple suppliers remotely across a range of events ensuring contracts are delivered on time and as per specification Liaise with the finance team to ensure all invoices are paid prior and post events Draft event copies and event invites and properly upload events onto GEM Work with editorial teams to ensure all copy has been properly edited Work with in-house design team for branded collateral Review and understand contracts and in-house event processes, liaising with the legal and H&S teams to have executed prior to events Ensure Soho House style is evident at each event. Demonstrate a keen understanding of the member user-experience, food, beverage and event styling Hands-on approach to event management, happy to lead by example and take on any task required to deliver the event to the highest standard possible Key Skills: Project Management - ability to manage all areas of a project concurrently, both on-site and remotely A multi-tasker and great organizer - ability to manage multiple projects at once, both on-site and remotely Event Management – 4+ years’ experience, or equivalent experience in event production or event management A strong communicator – ability to communicate production elements with all external partners, clients, colleagues and key internal stakeholders Budgets - proven experience of managing budgets Strong social skills for dealing with and developing client, suppliers, staff relationships, and Soho House members Excellent negotiation skills for dealing with suppliers Design & Styling – ability to style spaces that are on brand with Soho House’s design style Food & Beverage experience – working with chefs and bartenders to create relevant menus People management – clear briefing and on-event managerial skills Own black book of APAC suppliers and related contacts Familiarity with working with local authorities/land owners in relation to permissions, permits etc. Self-starter – a naturally driven and motivated individual who takes their own initiative is essential Cultural competence - understanding and respect for the local culture is key and should be taken into account when producing events Requirements Bachelor’s degree and/ or 4+ years equivalent industry experience Detail oriented Excel and powerpoint skills Must have flexible schedule including evenings, holidays, and weekends; with a willingness to travel Must have a healthy and active interest in outside cultural events Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment Operations experience in a managerial or training role within the events industry A sophisticated communicator with high standards of performance together with excellent communication, problem solving and listening skills Benefits Soho House offers competitive compensation packages that feature global benefits and perks. Whether you’re seeking entry-level employment or a new opportunity to expand your profession, we offer training to develop the technical and managerial skills necessary to grow your career.

Job Description POSITION SUMMARY The Infrastructure Reliability Engineering - Network Services team provides 2nd level support to manage the day to day operations for Visa Inc’s network. As a Network Support Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to support, manage, and implement improvements to Visa’s global network based on ITIL change, incident and problem management process. This involves working with a 1st level and 2nd level global operations team with 24x7 follow-the-sun coverage. You will work closely with the Network Engineering and Network Tools teams in supporting, managing and implementing improvements to Visa’s global network and also with applications and systems teams to manage and troubleshoot network connectivity. This position is within Infrastructure Reliability Engineering - Network Services team, that architects, engineers and operates Visa’s global backbone, datacenter, and access networks. The Infrastructure Reliability Engineering team is centered around hiring and developing diverse talents who are passionate about building and operating best-in-the-breed infrastructure through technology and innovation. JOB SCOPE This is an individual contributor responsible for identifying and resolving issues of advanced complexity. This position is at a senior professional level and requires strong/advanced execution and analytical abilities. This role works independently and receives minimal guidance. RESPONSIBILITIES Troubleshoot and resolve complex 2nd level network related problems, coordinate resources where necessary and serve as escalation point to 1st level operational teams Respond to and resolve IP network issues within the timeframe of severity level agreements Deploy client solutions and network design implementations Support all aspects of the network management process assuring requests, implementation, and problems are delivered as required with no impact to the global communications environment Take initiative to proactively discover potential network impacts Participate in or lead problem resolution and root-cause analysis Participate in tasks related to change, incident and problem management Document, create and maintain operational run-books based from best practice and from knowledge/experience gained from day-to-day operations for continuous operational improvement. Conduct internal technical briefing/training for level1 and level2 network operations team Deploy and document changes in accordance with problem and change management process Participate in managing projects introduced by engineering team assuring full implementation and documentation standards are adhered to. Complete the projects objectives within timelines Communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences, resolution and root cause resulting from the outage or service interruption Perform most effective approach to restore, recover, or alter configurations, logical or physical, to maintain service integrity Perform weekends shift duties on rotational basis. Qualifications Additional Information

Location: Jtc Launchpad @ One-North, Queenstown, Singapore, Central Region
Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of communications and policy work experience. Preferred qualifications: 6 years of experience with product and policy communications. Experience with creative storytelling, proactive press outreach, and building relationships. Experience communicating complex legal and policy-related topics, excellent written and verbal communications skills, and experience as an on the record spokesperson. Ability to speak and write in English fluently. About the job As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; and develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more. As a member of the Global Communications and Public Affairs team, you will be responsible for YouTube's external communications. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video, and more. As Policy Communications Manager for YouTube APAC, you’ll work with colleagues in functions across the company to tell clear stories about our policies and YouTube's reputation in the region. As part of this role, you will work closely with our country, regional, and global communications teams as well as cross-functional teams to design and execute responsibility campaigns, work on issues to explain YouTube's community guidelines and our approach on complex topics. You'll need to be able to combine creativity with the organization to manage numerous different projects simultaneously, as well as enjoy decoding complex topics for press and Key Opinion Formers. As an avid consumer of news, you'll spot communications opportunities and advise on reputation threats. It's our job to help inform and educate users, advertisers, partners, opinion leaders--and our own employees--about the benefits of Google's products, our distinctive company culture/values, and our approach to the big public policy issues of the day. To succeed here, you'll combine creativity with organizational skills to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines simultaneously, as well as enjoy pitching to journalists, bloggers and commentators, or producing internal communications and events for our employees. Things happen quickly at Google and to get stuff done here you need to be an enthusiastic team player who can work cross-functionally and isn't hesitant to take risks or try new things. Resposibilities Craft and execute communication strategies and campaigns around our key corporate and policy topics and issues, reaching audiences including policy-makers, opinion formers, and the public. Job_Title: Audit - Regional Head of Internal Audit Practices, Executive Director
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : The Regional Head of Internal Audit Practices reports to the Regional Chief Auditor with dual accountability to the Global Head of Practices. This role is a member of the Audit Leadership Team (ALT) - the senior leadership team who are each direct reports to an Audit Operating Committee member. This role is responsible for regional leadership of our Audit Practice, driving and executing the regional Practices agenda items including methodology, regulatory engagement, reporting & control and quality assurance. This must be achieved in a manner that meets all regional regulatory requirements yet is consistent with global expectations and with driving and influencing positive change throughout the department. The Regional Head of Internal Audit Practices will provide value by developing trusted relationships with business executives, global Audit Management, Internal Audit staff and regulators and must possess the ability to influence and lead change. Principal Duties and Responsibilities : Drive Business Results: Lead the development of Regional JPMC Internal Audit practice objectives and strategic direction, ensuring consistency with the global practice objectives and strategy Provide thought leadership and respectful challenge as appropriate on methodology, tools, processes etc., acting to ensure that any Regional variances are recognized to represent additional activities required by local regulators Assess and enhance core Internal Audit (IA) practices to meet the expectations of Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA) standards, the firm, and global regulatory agencies, with particular attention to local regulatory requirements that might be incremental or different from global standards Be a subject matter expert on IA methodology, policies, processes and toolsets in order to respond to incoming queries and drive efficiency and consistency. Provide strategic Practices direction on emerging risks or issues that IA must address Active participation and representation of the region in the key forums to input into the change agenda. Ensure that the region supported is aware of all relevant audit methodology and toolset changes to eliminate confusion and promote a common understanding Lead, influence and oversee the regional implementation of tools, metrics and reporting to monitor adherence to audit policies and standards and completion of the audit plan, including regular analysis of results. Improve People Management & Leadership : Strategic ownership of the resource and talent in the Regional Practices Team. Activities may include recruiting, assigning and counselling team members as well as performing job analysis for each role, clearly identifying and articulating responsibilities of each role, together with required skill-sets, qualifications etc. Own critical relationships across the region, establishing a culture of engagement and adding value to the department Monitor Risk, Control and Conduct: Build and maintain close and effective relationships with the firm's external auditors and with regulators in the Region. Direct the regional Audit regulatory interaction, including support of Audit regulatory request responses, exam status monitoring, and regulatory issue closure validation Support an effective Quality Assurance program by proactively reviewing their work and conclusions for regional applicability, and sharing with regional audit management to ensure globally consistent audit methodology is followed across all locations General Responsibilities: Work closely with the Audit Leadership Team and the Regional Chief Auditor to initiate and drive strategic initiatives and projects Identify, escalate and if necessary remediate potential issues with regards to audit execution, regulatory interaction and general matters in a timely manner to understand the root cause, prevent recurrence and help create solutions. Knowledge, Skills and Experience Minimum of a Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline 15+ years of relevant experience including Audit and/or Financial Services 10 years managing and leading teams (management capacity) Uphold the reputation of the firm and act with integrity Proven ability to work and think with a global as well as regional mindset with a track record of global partnership and influence In-depth understanding of audit practices and methodologies, internal controls, and risk assessment and management processes. Uses this knowledge to identify opportunities for improvement Broad experience of managing operational processes required to run a large business function. This should include technology infrastructure, internal and external reporting, regulatory exam management, real estate strategy and talent planning. Strategic and visionary in anticipating risk issues for different businesses units within the Audit function Able to demonstrate a general understanding and working knowledge of all banking business areas Excellent relationship management skills - across the Audit function, across JP Morgan Chase and with external parties Effective in expressing a point of view and influencing team members, senior management and regulators Strong fact based decision making skills with the ability to secure support at all levels Operates with a sense of urgency, provides credible challenge as needed to all levels of management Ability to remain focused on the big picture while understanding the detail Exceptional verbal and written communication skills ability to present information clearly and in a way that is appropriate to the audience Delivery focused with a track record of execution Demonstrated leader with excellent management skills and ability to cultivate a strong team work environment Experience driving and delivering strategic improvements and measurable change Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and assess and change priorities as needed Effective under pressure and willing to take personal responsibility/accountability Commercially astute: Has a track record of making commercially viable business decisions

Job_Title: CIB F&BM - Lending Product Control/US External Reporting - Associate
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Credit Portfolio Group (CPG) Lending is one of the key sub-groups within Banking and is mandated to actively manage the Corporate and Investment Bank's retained credit exposures resulting from traditional lending. CPG is responsible for developing and executing strategies with the primary goals of reducing credit risk concentration and losses from credit events. The business can execute these objectives via a variety of methods including loan assignments, macro hedges and other bespoke derivative hedges. The Asia Lending Product Controller team are responsible for ensuring the overall integrity and validity of the financial statements and controls over the transaction cycle, performing critical reporting functions for the organization including financial and regulatory, product valuation, improving ongoing processes and ensuring execution and implementation of the overall financial architecture. Responsibilities: The Asia Lending Product Controller team is seeking to hire a highly motivated candidate to join the regional team based in Singapore and support the tasks below but are not limited to the following areas: Assist with daily P&L reporting and month-end close processes including but not limited to review of financial data, investigating significant variances and transactions, fluctuation analysis, preparation of financial reporting deliverable, preparation of estimate accruals, perform reconciliations, general ledger substantiation etc. Lead and manage all US external reporting impacting Lending and Trade & Working Capital business. Responsible for the compilation of financial statements, footnotes, management's discussion and analysis and all other components of the filings. Ensure internal control procures are in place and maintain SOX compliance. Ensure financial information is in compliance with US & local GAAP and firm's corporate accounting policies, documenting exceptions where appropriate Partner with the business to drive forth and implement robust controls and new business initiatives Drive coordination across various front & back office support functions to ensure resolution of control and reporting issues in an accurate and timely manner Driving change and improvement in process in order to improve transparency and efficiency in month-end results. Serve as an analytical and project support resource for product control Handle various ad-hoc requests on a daily basis Engage in New Business Initiatives and provide inputs related to accounting and booking issues. Establish and maintain strong working relationship with various stakeholders (e.g. Front office Traders/Portfolio manager, Legal entity controller, Credit risk, Loan operations, Global controller team, Planning & Analysis group etc.) Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of experience in accounting or external audit in the financial services industry Bachelor's Degree in Accountancy, Finance or related area Qualified accountant (CA/CPA/ACA/CIMA/ACCA) an advantage Enthusiastic, highly motivated and effective under tight timeframes and pressure Proven skills in identifying and resolving control issues that may impact financial results Experience reviewing/creating complex operational and general ledger process flows Excellent communication skills and executive presence including the ability to present complex and sensitive matters Strong interpersonal, communication and team-building skills Ability to manage several projects and tasks concurrently Ability to evaluate the design and effectiveness of internal financial controls Advanced MS Excel skills and MS PowerPoint skills are essential Team player and ability to work closely with global team members and other groups in the organization. Good knowledge of SAP ledger system is preferred Good knowledge of Lending products (loans and derivatives) and US external reporting would be advantageous

Job_Descriptions: Job Description : The role is in a critical front office facing application which is across many asset classes including Fixed Income, Hedge Funds, Mutual Funds and Equities etc. As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Responsibilities Will be part of high-caliber development team that works closely with business stakeholders in wealth management side to deliver end to end solutions Able to work individually or as part of co-located team/globally distributed team to achieve on time delivery of projects Will be responsible for full software development life cycle -Requirement gathering, design, coding, deployment management, production issue management Adhere to best development standards e.g. TDD/BDD, CICD Deliver high quality code including 90%+ Code coverage Build cloud native applications using private, public, hybrid cloud technologies Willingness to learn and adopt to new technology and tool sets Learn finance domain to work closely with business stakeholders Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent in science, technology, mathematics or other related discipline 5 or more years of software development experience using Java tech stack, including but not limited to: Core Java, Spring or Spring Boot, Junit, Mockito Experience with one or more UI technologies, preferably Angular or React Experience with one or more database technologies, e.g. Oracle, Sybase and ArangoDB Experience in building REST APIs Knowledge of test-driven development and testing frameworks Knowledge of one or more cloud technologies like Cloud foundry, AWS Knowledge of one or more messaging technologies, e.g. Kafka, IBM MQ Knowledge of data formats like JSON, XML Experience in Agile development methodologies Experience in version control tools like SVN, GIT Ability to innovate, High level of motivation to get things delivered Strong interpersonal skills and team building attitude Good to have Experience in Wealth Management domain Knowledge on container technologies like Kubernetes, Docker Knowledge on building Micro services Experience with distributed caches like GemFire, ehCache, Hazelcast Knowledge on monitoring tools like Splunk, Dynatrace

Job_Title: Wealth Management - Business Analysis Associate I - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Business Overview J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, with client assets of $2.4 trillion, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits . Operations Overview Operations are uniquely positioned at the heart of all that we do. We impact the business we undertake from end to end - involved in almost all major steps of the transaction lifecycle as well as new initiatives (account opening and KYC, products and services) and vendor management. We work in collaboration with counterparts from all areas across Lines of Business, Technology, Finance and Corporate Functions. Our role is all about maintaining the efficient processes our people rely on every day to do first-class business, whilst constantly striving to achieve the improvement that makes the firm one of the most respected financial institutions in the world. The global focus on Anti Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Client (KYC) is increasing and leading to new roles and opportunities within JP Morgan. The firm is establishing within Operations a market-leading function to help manage the client onboarding transformation whilst meeting regulatory risks involved in Onboarding clients. We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and growing team in a fast paced and challenging area. Key Responsibilities: The Client Onboarding Business Analytics & Reporting role is part of the IPB Business Enablement Team and will report to the Business Analytics and Transformation Manager.The role will provide reporting and data analytic services to the Client Ops organization.It will work closely with the wider team to support the delivery of a transformed client experience that is cost effective for the business. Focus areas include owning BaU MIS provision and leading initiatives that enable more efficient and sustainable MIS provision to support Client Operations and bring insights that will enable the transformation journey. Support all aspects of management activities for Asia Business Enablement Lead provision of BaU MIS to ensure teams have access to information they need Support transformation of Asia wide MIS provision leverage new tools and techniques to enable operational efficiencies, generate insights and adapt to strategic transformation agenda with transparent governance model Support implementation projects from an Onboarding BAU perspective, Ensure the team is supported to provide a detailed analysis and understanding of complex workflows and explaining them to colleagues across the business, and able to escalate appropriately any risks identified in business process Ensure that all IPB sitelocations and groups that support IPB work to the same standard of efficiency and establish a best in class function Support the preparation of presentations to Senior Management and various stakeholdersof the Private Bank Qualifications: What do we look for Candidates with relevant degree or relevant work experience in similar role Maintains a sense of urgency and ability to prioritize/multi-task. Minimum 3 years working experience including roles in AML/ KYC in the context of client onboarding and in a control function is preferred The role will support projects and new processes within Client Onboarding therefore minimum 3 years previous experience of this type of work within a Client Onboarding environment is required Strong Attention to detail, results oriented and delivery focused Excellent Organizational skills Strong written and oral communication skills, able to influence internal and external stakeholders Strong analytical, prioritization and organizational skills Minimum 3 years experience in Excel and data analytics Minimum 1years experience in Alteryx or similar ETL tools Knowledge of data analysis and tools (e.g. Python, Hadoop) tool is an added advantages Logical, structured approach to planning, problem solving and decision-making Strong risk and controls awareness Capacity to think laterally and convey an understanding of the big picture Minimum Bachelor degree holder

Job Description : As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation & engineering practices. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system that provides functionality for traders, salespeople, operations and product control staff globally. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income, credit and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. The code is a combination of Python and C++: C++ for speed, and Python for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to provide a continuous deployment environment, and pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues, while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs. As the Athena Python developer, you will be responsible for the design and delivery of the tooling used by trading and other business partners in the energy space of the commodities group. In addition to strong technical development skills, an agile mindset is required to be able to focus on both strategic initiatives and streamline the day-to-day trading activities of the desk. The position also involves managing a team of software developers, covering their book of work, technical design and deployment. Development is on JPMorgan's Athena risk management platform, therefore strong python knowledge is essential. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor degree Minimum 4years of software engineering experience in Financial Services sector Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines Advanced knowledge of architecture, design across all systems Proficiency in multiple modern programming languages, preferably Python or C++ Knowledge of industry wide technology trends and best practices Knowledge of Commodities business is a huge preference. Keen understanding of financial control and budget management Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture

Job Description : Working in Information Security Management, you'll design and implement processes and tools that safeguard the firm's computing environment. Creating action plans, mitigating risks, and resolving control issues, you'll gain key insight into today's complex risk and regulatory landscape. Working with our cybersecurity team, you'll be at the forefront of innovation designed to strengthen our operations. Additionally, you'll have the chance to participate in steering committees, promote IT security awareness across the firm, advise and support business security risk and control activities, and drive your career in any direction you choose. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor's degree or equivalent educational qualifications Minimum 5 yearsof relevant work experience. Advanced knowledge of multiple IT control and project management practices, plus experience working across large environments Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals Expertise in application and infrastructure high-availability and resiliency architectures Proficiency in information security domains, including policies and standards, risk and control assessments, access controls, regulatory compliance, technology resiliency, risk and control governance and metrics, incident management, secure systems development lifecycle, vulnerability management, and data protection

Job_Title: Software Engineer - Currencies and Emerging Markets, Associate
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system that provides functionality for traders, salespeople, operations and product control staff globally. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income, credit and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. The code is a combination of Python and C++: C++ for speed, and Python for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to provide a continuous deployment environment, and pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues, while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs. The Currencies and Emerging Markets (CEM) Athena team delivers business critical trade capture, risk management, transaction processing and trader tools to the CEM business globally. The CEM Athena roles requiretechnically strong and disciplined python developers. A record of delivering high quality, well-tested solutions in a mature controlled environment is a prerequisite.The rolesrequire an ability to attain clear understanding of Athena environment and of the unique design considerations that come into play in a diverse and highly interdependent systems environment. A high level of interaction with the business is required as the applications involved are revenue generating and directly used by the businesses globally. This is a unique opportunity for delivery-minded individuals to take ownership of the full software development lifecycle, partnering with the CEM business to understand and improve business workflows. The successful candidate will be empowered to build relationships with the Singapore front-office and quantitative research teams in order to deliver local requirements, provide business face-off and technical support, enhancements and fixesto the localusers,as well as to own the delivery of Asia Pacificrequirements on large-scale, global re-engineering initiatives This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor'sdegree Minimum 3years of software engineering experience in Financial Services sector Proficiency in Python programming language Experience in developing and supporting complex systems used for intraday risk management Deep understanding of risk management concepts and product knowledge in the Fixed Income space Enthusiastic, self-motivated, strong interest in learning, effective under pressure and willing to take personal responsibility / accountability. Eager to take ownership of work, have real business impact, overcome obstacles and take it through to completion, working as part of this team and collaborating with a much bigger community of developers sharing the technology and code base. Ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently in an efficient and effective manner with minimal supervision. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to present complex issues to non-technical users and to influence change. Good problem solving skills with an ability to find creative, out of the box solutions to complex problems. Good understanding of Agile development methodologies, responsible for elucidating and agreeing requirements, building relationships with business users, and taking ownership of deliverables all the way to the production environment and beyond. Focus on testing through the entire development cycle to produce reliable and maintainable software
