Job Description : Job summary At Amazon we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build our Public Sector team then this is your chance to make history. The Public Sector Global Lead Development Team is expanding! As a Lead Development Representative (LDR) you will be an important member of the sales organization, playing a critical role in qualifying leads, profiling customers and providing input on which sales campaigns generate the best leads. Working in collaboration with your global peers, marketing, account managers and the partner channel, objective is to identify and create qualified opportunities for Singapore. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. The successful candidate will: . Manage incoming leads in a timely manner in a wider geographical . Conduct discussions with prospects and existing customers over the phone to identify and qualify opportunities . Understand customer pain points, gather technical requirements and correlate business value to customer needs . Generate interest and provide vision of the portfolio of AWS solutions to potential customers . Understand existing and developing technologies as it relates to cloud computing . Achieve monthly qualification goals . Update and maintain customer information within SalesForce.com . Provide account management team with detailed call notes to ensure the opportunity is understood and next steps are clearly defined . Present a high level, technical solution to diverse audiences which include AWS colleagues, prospects and customers relevant to target industry or market (Singapore) Basic Qualifications : . University Degree or equivalent experience . 1 to 2 years of experience in sales prospecting or phone based sales . 1 year or more of experience using a CRM/Customer Relationship Management tool . 1 year or more of experience using the Microsoft Office Suite . Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English to cover the Singapore Public Sector Preferred Qualifications : . Target orientated, ambitious, creative, customer focused . Experience with IT, tech or cloud (aaS), passion for technology . Self-starter with highly developed interpersonal skills and organizational skills, decisive and result oriented who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment . Experience working with Public Sector customers #aws-sgp-pubsec-ap

Job Description : Job summary Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started changing the way millions of people around the world enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Boys UK-produced hit Amazon Original series like Good Omens, The Grand Tour, All or Nothing: Manchester City and forthcoming drama series The Power exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings and movies like Late Night and Get Duked, plus live sport including ATP and WTA Tour and US Open Tennis and Premier League football. Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon's Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights. Our Southeast Asian Originals team supports the U.S based Amazon Studios team with all Originals productions in Southeast Asia (SEA). We are looking for an experienced, dynamic, creative and self-motivated Senior Film Development Executive to support our Movies efforts for the Indonesian market. This role will be based in Singapore. The ideal candidate has extensive experience in both Development and Production, and the ability to identify strong material and talent, and give creative guidance and feedback to top level writers and directors on outlines, scripts, and cuts. They must have comprehensive knowledge of top tier film talent in Indonesia. They are creative thinkers and problem solvers, with the drive to innovate and experiment, and can thrive in a collaborative environment but are also comfortable working autonomously. Strong interpersonal skills and project management skills are a must. Key job responsibilities . Support the U.S. based Amazon Studios Local Originals team in relation to the development and production of Indonesian Original movies, including providing local oversight of 3rd party partners, and communicating effectively with senior leadership and other internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with leadership goals and successful execution of local productions. . Assist international teams to source and analyze submissions based on slate goals, and provide local insights and feedback for senior leadership approval. . Support the U.S. based Amazon Studios Local Originals team in relation to all internal film development and production processes such as greenlights, business reviews etc. . Coordinate and interface with external and internal business partners including but not limited to: marketing, business affairs, legal, PR, creative, production, and post-production teams to ensure all stages of a project's lifecycle are executed properly. . Serve as primary liaison between the U.S. based Amazon Studios team and a wide-range of external producers in Indonesia. Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's degree and/or graduate degree or equivalent experience. . Extensive experience in both Development and Production, as a Producer or Commissioner with an in-depth knowledge of the Indonesian movie landscape. . Excellent communication and writing skills in both BI and English. . Experience working with a broad network of creators, producers, production companies, writers and talent. Preferred Qualifications : . Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment. . Creative thinker with a passion for movies who is not limited by industry norms. . Curiosity in learning about various cultures and local markets. . High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information. . Creative problem-solver. . Positive, proactive and able to consistently exercise great judgement.

Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Boys UK-produced hit Amazon Original series like Good Omens, The Grand Tour, All or Nothing: Manchester City and forthcoming drama series The Power exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings and movies like Late Night and Get Duked, plus live sport including ATP and WTA Tour and US Open Tennis and Premier League football. You will have experience in both Development and Production, with the ability to identify material and talent. Identifying potential new creative talent in line with senior leadership's development initiatives. . Review pilot proposals, scripts, and pitches to shortlist for senior leadership approval scripts that would be aligned with leadership's goals for the Indonesian market. . Job_Title: Head of Insights SE Asia, Amazon Studios
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary Are you interested in diving deep to understand customers and drive improvements for the Prime Video business Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started changing the way millions of people enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals such as the Emmy Award-winning comedies Fleabag and The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Boys, Mindy Kaling's Late Night, Donald Glover's Guava Island, the Academy Award-winning Manchester by the Sea, Academy Award-nominated The Big Sick, exclusives, and live concerts and sports. Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon's Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights. The Global Studios Consumer Insights team at Amazon Studios is looking for a Head of Studios Consumer Insights Southeast Asia (SEA) to oversee audience research, content testing and market analysis across Movies and Series. The role will be based in Singapore and the remit will encompass Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines and Thailand. The ideal candidate will have led high impact research initiatives, have management experience and come with 7+ years of work experience in the market research field. This role will report into the Head of Global Consumer Insights for Amazon Studios and will be responsible for driving strategic research initiatives across Creative Development, Strategy, Marketing, Finance and Data Science teams across SEA. The candidate will have prior experience managing quant and qual studies end to end with a keen sense of how to use primary, secondary and big data analytics to make business decisions. At Amazon, leaders are owners and never say that's not my job. The successful candidate will also have the ability to operate at all levels and take the reins on project work when necessary from owning individual projects, writing reports to the presentation of insights and recommendations. This position will not start with a direct report but there is an opportunity to grow a team as the business matures in key expansion markets. Key job responsibilities . Represent the voice of the customer at every meeting . Manage market research initiatives to support international leadership in defining consumer insights that lead to a deeper understanding of the Prime Video Customer and overall digital streaming population in SEA . Drive research projects through the lifecycle of a series/movie to help Amazon Studios international team create ambitious and compelling content . Identify high impact inputs in relation to the creative direction of Amazon Originals and how they can be marketed in SEA . Translate complex data sets into clear and compelling written narratives for Prime Video Leadership Executives . Drive the development and adoption of prediction models alongside Data Science and Strategy teams . Work closely with Marketing teams to provide local market research insights that will help position our content for success . Champion Diversity and Inclusion initiatives Basic Qualifications : . 7+ years in the market research field . Management experience, 3+ years . Experience scoping and building processes and process enhancements . Direct experience leading primary research studies across various methodologies: online quant surveys, focus groups, 1:1, ethnographies, online qual, mobile . Exhibit strong written and verbal communication skills to convey key insights to senior leaders . Third party vendor/research partner management experience . Deep understanding of and passion for television and movie content . Experience with applied statistics, predictive analytics, and mixed methodology research . Experience leading different types of studies such as episode testing, dial and theatre testing, concept testing, series maintenance Preferred Qualifications : . Experience on the research vendor side or within the research group of a media company . Passion for movie and TV series content

Job_Title: Head of Production, Southeast Asia Local Original Movies
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary Are you interested in shaping the future of television Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started changing the way millions of people enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals such as the Emmy Award-winning comedies Fleabag and The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Boys, Mindy Kaling's Late Night, Donald Glover's Guava Island, the Academy Award-winning Manchester by the Sea, Academy Award-nominated The Big Sick, exclusives, and live concerts and sports. Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon's Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights. Amazon Studios is hiring a Head of Production - Southeast Asia (SEA) Local Original Movies to support local original movie production across SEA. This position will be based in Singapore. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing and managing local SEA Amazon production personnel who are supporting the Amazon Studios Local Originals team. This team will support the Local Originals team with monitoring budgets, schedules and production plans for local original movies to be produced for the SEA market in local languages. The position will work closely with local Amazon production executives and internal stakeholders, including Post-Production, Business Affairs, Legal, Tax and Creative Development. Additionally, the Head of Production for SEA will also be responsible for hiring and developing the best talent to join the team as they scale and support the increasing regional slate and territorial expansion. Key job responsibilities . Manage a team of production executives throughout SEA. . Hire, train, supervise and set career growth plans for the team. . Develop team goals, roadmap and strategy consistent with international leadership. . Support the Amazon Studios Local Originals team to produce scripted content in the most economical and efficient manner with the highest production value by maximizing local and regional production benefits and subsidies. . Work with other stakeholders throughout the company to support creation of policies and procedures that are scalable for utilization across multiple territories in SEA. . Provide insights on local custom and practice, and government regulation, to assist with resolving problems with SEA productions. . Provide oversight of the local original movie projects in development and production throughout South East Asia, and coordinate effectively between external partners and international leadership to ensure projects are completed on schedule. . Collaborate with local executives in each territory along with producers, line producers, production managers to assess budgets, production plans, and schedules. Provide feedback to international leadership on production risks and/or options that can impact staying on budget and schedule. . Work with all internal teams, both locally and in the U.S., including post operations, production finance, tax, legal and development. . Travel throughout Asia when necessary to assist leadership with evaluation of work-flow, budgets and potential problems, and provide feedback. . Provide support to local production executives with respect to the analysis of budgets and cost reports. . Act as a liaison from producers to the Local Originals Studio team when required. Basic Qualifications : . 15+ years of experience as Film or Television Producer/Production Executive or the equivalent with a focus on local Asian and International content. . Ability to juggle multiple large scale projects efficiently in a fast-paced environment while delivering outstanding results. . Direct leadership experience, having managed teams in the corporate or production space. . A strong understanding of South East Asian motion picture industry custom and practice and an appreciation of the differences that exist in each territory. . Extensive experience obtaining Asian production benefits, subsidies, tax credits and reclaiming VAT or similar taxes when applicable. . A strong working knowledge of basic co-production and financial structures. . Ability and availability to travel when required. Preferred Qualifications : . Experience with local guilds and unions . Multiple Asian language proficiency . Experience working on international productions. . Able to recognize an opportunity or need based on industry expertise. . Exceptional and effective verbal and written communication skills. . Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills. . Exceptional project management skills. . Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role. . Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role. . Familiarity with Movie Magic Budgeting & Scheduling software. . Ability to review budget and scheduling documentation produced by the above software.

Job_Title: Head of Enterprise Strategy and Operations
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary AWS is one of Amazon's fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Spotify, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. We help global and local enterprises to use cloud to remediate their legacy technology and build new innovative businesses. In this role, the Head of Sales Strategy Operations and Enablement (SSOE) will develop and execute the strategy, continuously evolve forecasting models, analyze historic results and be a trusted partner to the APJ Enterprise Director making recommendations based on those analyses - all in an environment of hyper-scaling growth and increasing complexity. As a member of the APJ Enterprise leadership team, this role will be working with regional and global AWS leaders across multiple functions to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize Business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives. The role will drive the management cadence of the business including mechanisms such as OP1/2 2x2 and weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting. The role drives improvements and updates to the reporting tools, methods, and processes utilized by the team to increase the availability and granularity of actionable data for our customers. This position also manages the proposal, administration and execution of the regional targets and goals, headcount plans, including market segmentation and proposing improvements to the business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results. This role leads a large, multi-layered organization that spans 11 countries and direct reporting functions include operations, sales strategy, sales incentive and customer and sales enablement teams. Business Intelligence, Business Development, Finance, Human Resources, Marketing, Recruiting, and Compensation teams are critical extended stakeholder teams. The successful candidate will be an excellent organizational and people leader, who can hire and develop the best talent across their organization including coaching and developing senior direct reports. They will be a superb written and verbal communicator. They will be comfortable presenting to the senior AWS leadership and influencing regional and global stakeholders across the Sales organization. They will be able to see round corners by identifying critical internal and external trends, they will be detail orientated, with a passion for inventing and simplifying to deliver operational excellence at scale. They will work backwards from their internal and external customers, they will be able to roll-up their sleeves working directly with models and data as well as ideating and driving strategic priorities for the region. Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field . 15+ years experience in strategy consulting or strategy roles in a large-scale hi-tech companies. . Experience leading large, complex organizations. . Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for CRM, sales compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting, sales force automation . Expert level in Excel and Data query tools . Strong business-process design experience . Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results . Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly . Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management Preferred Qualifications : . Experience in Asia Pacific and Japan . MBA, PHD or other relevant advanced degree. . Deep expertise and familiarity with cloud product and services, and sales cycles. . Proficiency with annual forecasting and planning and related 3rd party tools. . Having presented to C-level executives (CIO, CEO, CTO, CISO, etc.) as well as to technical subject matter experts. What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description : Job summary At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and drive people. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a talented WFS Business Intel Engineer to help manage our ever-growing data & reporting needs and support analytics of an increasingly complex business related to Workforce Staffing (WFS) across the Singapore. As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will generate insights that will guide operational excellence and business strategy for our customers. Data analysis is at the core Amazon's culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for our organization. You will be gathering customer insights, mining data, making recommendations, and helping senior leaders make key business decisions. You will have the opportunity to work with large and diverse data sets to gather insights using data from across Amazon Operations. The ideal candidates will have excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and judgment, intense curiosity, strong technical skills, and superior written and verbal communication skills. They will have a strong bias toward data driven decision making. They will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative (while paying careful attention to detail). Enjoys working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. If you are excited about data, are results oriented, and want to join a growing analytics team within Amazon, this role is for you. Key job responsibilities . Be part of a high performing team of Business Intelligence Engineers . Constantly challenging the status quo and proposing alternative solutions to drive the efficiency . Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support the needs of the business. . Apply deep analytic and business intelligence skills to extract meaningful insights. . Be hands-on with ETL to build data pipeline to support automated reporting. . Serve as liaison between the business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations to support future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations. . Build various data visualizations to tell the story of business trends, patterns, and outliers through rich visualizations. . Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation. Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or a related discipline . 3+ years of relevant work experience in data science, business analytics, business intelligence (BI) . 3+ years of experience with Amazon QuickSight, Tableau Desktop or other relevant data visualization software . 3+ years of experience in data mining and/or data-set preparation using SQL . Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environment. Proficient understanding of data warehousing, data modeling methods. . Proficient with Python or other relevant scripting language Preferred Qualifications : . 5+ years of experience in a data engineer or BIE role with a technology company. . Be self-driven, details-oriented, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data. . Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical team, and senior management as required. . Familiarity with Amazon's AWS services including Glue, EC2, S3 and Redshift. . Experience working in large data warehouse environments

Job_Title: Head of Amazon Global Selling, SEA
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary Amazon provides enterprises the opportunity to sell their goods on the Amazon platform worldwide, and more than 2 million sellers have been using this Marketplace service today. Amazon is developing infrastructure aggressively to support this growth around the world, particularly in the booming cross border selling area. In this context, Amazon's Services team is seeking an experienced business leader, to identify the potential business opportunities for bringing South East Asia sellers and sell globally on Amazon marketplaces, as well as take part in defining the vision and go-to-market strategy. The ideal candidate is a seasoned senior level manager with a background in ecommerce and affiliated industries, and a reputation for hiring and developing the best talent. S/he will have a track record of success at driving results, partnering cross functionally, and professionally representing clients needs/perspectives to the various stakeholders. The candidate in this role will be an exceptionally strong analytical thinker with a history of driving process & strategy implementation. S/he will have a strong track record of supporting marketing initiatives, tactics, plans, processes, systems, and programs. S/he will be known for accurate forecasting, building strong relationships, and analytical leadership skills. S/he will thrive in a fast paced dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment and insist on the highest standards. Key job responsibilities . Identify the potential business opportunities for bringing South East Asia sellers and sell globally on Amazon marketplaces, as well as take part in defining the vision and go-to-market strategy. . Learn about Amazon's cross border e-commerce business, determine the right audience to recruit, develop, and optimize campaigns to reach monetization objectives expected from senior leaders. . Identify strategic partner prospects, prepare and participate in negotiations, analyze suggested terms, and manage relationships from start to finish. . Drive consensus within the Amazon's leadership team on overall strategy, roadmap and deliverables. . Work closely with both sales/business and technical/product management leaders to scope and execute a strategic business development plan aligned with our long-term objectives ensure we are prioritizing the right initiatives. . Translate market feedback into product requirements, and collect data and information to provide guidance for our strategies. . Serve as the main point of SEA contact for designated initiative, and work cross-functionally with internal Amazon stakeholders to coordinate our overall deliverable plans. Basic Qualifications : . Strong business development and project management skills with the ability to initiate relationships, assess partnership viability, work through long deal cycles, and close complex deals. . Natural leadership skills with the experience and seniority to help recruit and train a high performing team . Excellent analytical and planning abilities to design and oversee programmatic business development efforts. . Track record of successful on initiating, proposing cross functional projects and drive to implement. . Proven ability to own complex, strategic partnerships with industry leading organizations . Team player with strong persuasion skills able to drive consensus across multiple stakeholders . Must be technically competent and have a strong understanding of e-commerce technologies, including partner eco system. . Balance high-level strategic thinking with hands-on tactical work to get things done quickly . Data driven and quantitative mentality with an ability to back up ideas with facts or examples . Entrepreneurial with an inherent sense of urgency not afraid to take risks and get things done quickly while maintaining high standards . Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to speak effectively to any audience Preferred Qualifications : . 15+ years of experience in sales, business development, or partner management within ecommerce or technology sectors. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. . Demonstrated track record of winning/establishing strategic relationships with enterprise. customers/partners and/or brand owners. . Ability to think strategically and execute methodically. Adept at making data-driven decisions . Comfortable in a fast-paced, multi-tasked, high-energy environment . Flexibility to work across multiple time-zones in multiple languages. . Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, computer science or relevant field of study, MBA is a plus.

Job Description : Job summary Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud powering hundreds of thousands of business in hundreds of countries around the world. Data Center Services Procurement supports Data Center Global Services in obtaining the best services at the lowest costs, and manages the full Supplier Lifecycle including Strategic Sourcing and Intake, Onboarding, Solicitations, Spending and Transaction Policy (S&TP) Compliance, Contract management, Supplier Development, and portions of requisitioning and payment operations. We are seeking a Procurement professional to support the Asia Pacific data center construction space supporting various categories. As a Supply Chain Program Manager, you will work with the category manager in creating and supporting Vendor qualifications, request for proposals, vendor performance dashboards for construction, due diligence, and engineering services categories. You will also provide input on procurement processes and tools to help identify waste and enable innovation across teams. The ideal candidate must be collaborative. To be successful in this role, you must be highly analytical think strategically have a sense of urgency to meet customer timelines exhibit an intense curiosity and learning drive, succeed in a fast-paced environment engage key stakeholders where needed and have a high level of customer focus. Also, you must have a demonstrated track record of managing multiple projects and driving them to completion to meet business objectives. It will be critical to embrace and model Amazon's Leadership Principles and have an entrepreneurial spirit. Key job responsibilities Responsibilities Include but are not limited to: . Independently and cross-functionally deliver on projects/goals . Manage assigned supplier onboarding and qualification processes . Manage assigned tender events, and related follow-on contract generation supporting the Category Manager. . Manage post contract metrics and audit process to ensure payments are done for work awarded. . Identify dashboard requirements for metrics reporting and identify opportunities for process improvement and develop training documentation . Monitor and manage purchase requisition process using information provided by business owners and suppliers. About the team DC-PROS is a highly collaborative team that is focused on streamlining and managing procurement operations for AWS Data Center construction. We are a global group with diverse perspectives, but remain Customer Obsessed. Our team of professionals manage operations for the full procurement lifecycle and provide valued input on the process and improvement opportunities. Basic Qualifications : . BS/BA from an accredited University . 3 years of relevant work experience in a procurement organization Preferred Qualifications : . Advanced degree in Supply Chain Management or Finance . Knowledge of software tools used in procurement, demonstrated success in a metrics-oriented environment and an ability to create, track, analyze and report out on metrics . Experience as purchaser, buyer, or other operational role within a procurement organization . Meets/Exceeds functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description : Job summary Amazon Web Services Talent Acquisition's Global Talent Intelligence (AWS TA GTI) Program is seeking a Talent Intelligence Leader based in Singapore. The AWS TA GTI Program's mission is to accelerate the process of finding builders of all backgrounds using research and insights to enable Amazon Web Services Talent Acquisition (AWS TA) Teams to reach their strategic goals and AWS business partners to make informed talent decisions. The AWS GTI Program aims to be a force multiplier of talent for AWS TA by empowering recruiters and sourcers with research and talent intelligence in order to create efficient talent strategies for today and cultivate talent pools to support our growth tomorrow. OVERVIEW The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will be aligned to an AWS TA Team (or Teams) and will be responsible for leading and running a market and talent intelligence program that is unique to each team(s) respective AWS lane-of-business. AWS TA Team(s) and their respective lanes-of-business may span a variety of geographies with differing strategic goals and business requirements. The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will leverage data to work backwards from each customer's specific needs and create bespoke solutions to close gaps across a variety of talent initiatives. This role assists customers by looking around corners to solve current problems and create solutions that generate results at scale. The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will leverage a combination of global talent market and industry research as well as internal talent data to provide customers with valuable talent and market insights. This role works closely with recruitment teams and leaders at all levels to deliver relevant data and proposals that influence recruiting strategies. RESPONSIBILITIES The role is responsible for defining each program through data analysis that creates unique research projects that influences talent strategies and resource allocation within GTI's mission, vision, and tenets. Overall role responsibilities include: . Partner with hiring teams that stakeholders at all levels to understand organizational challenges and build work products that fit into a comprehensive end-to-end recruitment strategy . Participate in strategic business engagement with a focus on effectively defining a targeted passive candidate sourcing strategy across multiple job profiles within a designated national region, country, or countries . Provide recommendations as a talent researcher and sourcing subject matter expert that directly impact front-of-funnel activities . Define a profile-based sourcing strategy across a variety of different AWS business segments . Drive competitive intelligence research and analysis through various internal and external tools . Map talent and competitive intelligence through qualitative and quantitative research, and present insights in a compelling way that influences action . Effectively communicate with key stakeholders to build influence and ensure application of research products with the correct customers . Evaluate effectiveness of research over time via feedback loops or key metrics unique to each business, and adjust approaches as needed . Use funnel metrics which impact the business to drive actions and anticipate bottlenecks then proactively work backwards from the customer to produce research collateral that eliminates those bottlenecks . Independently Analyze and draw conclusions from a mix of quantitative and qualitative data and implement changes with your program as a result . Manage, prioritize, and close searches against timelines and set benchmarks, metrics to understand how to prioritize sourcing strategies to hit customer SLAs . Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within AWS's mission to deliver the highest quality results for the customers . Share best practices with recruitment teams and partner cross-functionally with other AWS TA Teams to create processes that impact positive candidate engagement . Successfully write narratives that are both project based (deliverables, timelines, formal tracking processes, etc.) and program based tailored to the audience in order to maximize impact and understanding . Develop and lead special projects that have an AWS TA Wide that impact at scale . Amply your customers voices with a data-driven approach during AWS TA organizational discussions to ensure their businesses unique challenges are represented in the decision making process . Influence and educate peers regarding research and sourcing best practices that lead to successful outcomes throughout AWS TA and Amazon TA Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional or military experience . 5+ years in recruiting, sourcing, program or project management, research, or consulting experience for a global corporate entity with a high hiring bar . 3+ years of experience creating market mapping and talent intelligence tools . 2+ years of building and managing the lifecycle of complex cross-functional programs or projects with considerable country or global impact . Experience with defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements in the talent identification process . Comprehensive understanding of the recruitment life cycle with particular expertise in both passive and active sourcing recruitment strategies . Proficient Excel skills (running and creating functions, pivot tables, charts, etc.) that enables the extraction and processing of data . Comfortable identifying passive candidates through 3P identification tools (LinkedIn Recruiter, Entelo, SeekOut, etc.) and pioneering experimental candidate identification methods (Google X-Ray Searches, event based sourcing, social media, etc.) . CTS/ATS experience with sourcing, tracking and managing candidates . As you will be conducting Talent Intelligence research for the Japan market and business, proficiency in Japanese language is a must. Preferred Qualifications : . Excellent communication skills, paired with sound business judgment and ability to cultivate relationships with stakeholders/customers at all organizational levels . Excels in an ambiguous environment while consistently delivering the right results with limited guidance under aggressive deadlines against multiple projects at one time . Customer obsessed, proactively working backwards from the customers current or anticipated needs to create bespoke solutions to close process gaps . Self-starting, entrepreneurial spirit with understanding of how to use data and calculated risk-taking to drive innovative change . Experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, QuickSight, Salesforce etc.) Here at Amazon - . We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. . Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. . Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description : Job summary At Amazon we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally bright, talented and driven people. If you like to be part of a fast growing and entrepreneurial organization, bringing innovation and cloud adoption to the forefront for Enterprise customers, this is the job for you. Amazon Web Services (AWS) Training and Certification team are looking for an experienced Sales Consultant who understands the value of cloud fluency & adoption to help grow our AWS Skills Guild business. An AWS Skills Guild is an AWS Training & Certification service that enables customers to develop new capabilities and capacity for Cloud and Amazon related services and solutions and accelerate cloud outcomes. It is a comprehensive skills enablement program that applies cloud skilling and cloud adoption techniques to build cloud fluency and establish new ways of working across large Enterprise organisations. As a Cloud Transformation Enablement Sales Consultant, you will be required to own and drive the business development strategy and sales support function for the AWS Skills Guild team across Asia, Pacific, Japan & China (APJC). This will require working with both internal and external teams including Enterprise customers T&C business development teams marketing commercial sales industry vertical teams and partners. The focus will be on developing effective go-to-market strategies helping account teams identify, scope, qualify, and gain customer commitment for AWS Skills Guilds managing the pipeline and developing and implementing value-add attach and embed presales strategies that allow for scalability and high-volume growth. Key job responsibilities . Learn and become a subject matter expert on the AWS Skills Guild, cloud fluency, and cloud adoption using the AWS Platform. . Design and implement the AWS Skills Guild go-to-market, prospecting and lead generation strategy for APJC. . Support AWS Commercial Sales Account Teams, T&C Business Development Managers, and other key seller resources in APJC identify, scope, qualify, and gain customer commitment for AWS Skills Guilds. This includes evangelising and scoping the AWS Skills Guild with CxO/VP level stakeholders and participating in sales motions such as tender and RFP responses. . Meet or exceed APJC AWS Skills Guild sales targets and goals. Including but not limited to: # of Guild's launched, revenue generation, customer satisfaction, and new account penetration. . Analyse industry and Amazon internal data to understand the competitive landscape and identify customer trends as they pertain to cloud fluency and cloud adoption. Leverage this insight to support the APJC Skills Guild Head adjust the AWS Skills Guild sales and delivery strategy to accommodate growing trends and customer needs, and to help ensure AWS remains an industry leader in these fields. . Develop strong working relationships with both internal and external teams including Enterprise customers T&C business development teams marketing commercial sales industry vertical teams and partners for the purpose of selling AWS Skills Guilds. . Work closely with local and global Skills Guild peers to ensure APJC AWS Skills Guild sales strategy and activity aligns with the global sales and program enhancement strategies and varying regional delivery needs. . Work closely with marketing and business development teams to evangelise the AWS Skills Guild in internal and external forums and mediums (including but not limited to blogs white papers, articles, workshops, public-speaking events, and user-group events). . Design and drive seller enablement activities across APJC as they pertain to the AWS Skills Guild. . Oversee and report on the progress of all presales activities associated with the AWS Skills Guild in APJC. . Role model, coach and mentor others on the consistent application of the Amazon Leadership Principles. Proactively lead, engage and collaborate with other colleagues and teams effectively to achieve common external and internal business goals. Handle complex problems effectively and apply knowledge and skill to design and lead long-term solutions to ambiguous concepts. The successful incumbent will need to have the ability to travel across the Asia Pacific geographic area up to 50% of the time. Remote delivery will be leveraged when local and international travel restrictions are in place. About the team As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills. Basic Qualifications : . 6+ years sales and/or internal business development experience . 4 years+ experience in working within the consulting industry, ideally in the technical and/or human capital fields . Certification and / or at least 2 years experience selling organisational change related services . Experience in identifying, scoping, and supporting sales and account growth opportunities . Track record of consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets . Working knowledge of B2B sales, procurement processes, and experience working with senior management in large organisations . Experience evangelising a product and/or service through marketing forums such as blogs, whitepapers, and public speaking events . Experience working with different cultures & regions in the Asia, Pacific & Japan geographies . Experience working in global technology, with preference given to cloud adoption and/or enablement related roles . Salesforce.com experience Preferred Qualifications : . A bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a related field . Excellent written and verbal communication skills and c-suite advisory experience . Proven ability to lead in an ambiguous environment . Proven ability to influence others . Ability to present on stage at customer events for crowds of 250+ . Training & certification / learning & development business experience . Advanced knowledge of cloud services and/or cloud adoption

Job_Title: Senior Solutions Architect, ASEAN Public Sector
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary AWS is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders, we try new things, and imagine big dreams. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud technologies that enable our customers to adopt cloud based solutions. ABOUT THE TEAM This role is part of the ASEAN Public Sector team. As part of the team, you will work with our customers based out of our Singapore office. You will focus on the public sector, where you will work directly with customers from various government agencies, educational institutions, and non-profit organisations across all stages of their cloud journey. THE ROLE You will collaborate with customers, partners and other AWS teams to craft architectures, proof of concepts or demonstrations of our platform that work back from customer's business needs and accelerate the adoption of appropriate AWS technology. You will help shape and design solutions covering a spread of domains from migration of core enterprise applications to working with AI/ML, microservices, containers, app development, IoT to name a few. The ability to learn new technology and develop industry relevant architectures and convey business value is critical to the role. Building relationships to understand our customers is key. As a trusted technical advisor, you'll use your interpersonal skills to influence a variety of stakeholders from technical teams to executives. You'll help ensure their short-term technology decisions are aligned with their long-term goals. Speeding up the adoption of our services will be part of your day to day. You'll also act as an evangelist in the wider community. This includes taking part in educating, sharing best practices, presenting at events, writing white papers, blogs, and running workshops. You won't just want to be part of an industry movement you'll want to be leading it. As a Builder, you'll also have the chance to shape the direction of our products and services. This is through gathering feedback from customers whilst collaborating with our engineering and service teams. Want to find out what it's like to be a Solution Architect at AWS Watch this video (https://bit.ly/3keYcC9). What if I don't meet all the requirements That's okay! We hire people who have a passion for learning and are curious. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. Your onboarding will set you up for success, including a combination of formal and informal training. You'll also have a chance to gain AWS certifications and access mentorship programs. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we don't mind being called peculiar. We see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox. We believe in removing obstacles so builders can build which is why our people enjoy working in AWS. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Want to Come Build the Future with us Don't wait, apply today! Basic Qualifications : . Background in any other following or related to Technology Architect, Consultant, Cloud Architect, Technical Lead, Software Developers, Engineering Lead, Sales Engineer, Pre Sales Engineer or Systems Engineers, etc. . Will have experience and/or deeper understanding in one or more technology areas. Specific knowledge in multiple technology domain areas (e.g., software development, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics). . Can create proof of concepts, demos, and/or scripts from scratch or leveraging reusable components. . Understands and can articulate common architectural patterns and design principles . Can take the lead on a complex technical project, which may require the participation of other teams to deliver. . Able to create technical content that is easily adopted and reusable by others. Preferred Qualifications : . Experience architecting, migrating or transforming customer requirements to the cloud . Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS . One or more AWS certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate . Demonstrated thought leadership through public speaking and / or publications #aws-sgp-pubsec-ap

Job Description : Job summary Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started changing the way millions of people around the world enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Boys UK-produced hit Amazon Original series like Good Omens, The Grand Tour, All or Nothing: Manchester City and forthcoming drama series The Power exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings and movies like Late Night and Get Duked, plus live sport including ATP and WTA Tour and US Open Tennis and Premier League football. Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon's Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights. Our Southeast Asian Originals team supports the U.S. based Amazon Studios team with all Originals productions in Southeast Asia (SEA). We are looking for an experienced, dynamic, creative and self-motivated Senior Film Development Executive to support our Movies efforts for the Thailand market. This role will be based in Singapore. The ideal candidate has extensive experience in both Development and Production, and the ability to identify strong material and talent and give creative guidance and feedback to top level writers and directors on outlines, scripts, and cuts. They must have comprehensive knowledge of top tier film talent in Thailand. They are creative thinkers and problem solvers, with the drive to innovate and experiment, and can thrive in a collaborative environment but are also comfortable working autonomously. Strong interpersonal skills and project management skills are a must. Key job responsibilities . Support the U.S. based Amazon Studios team in relation the development and production of Thai Original movies, including providing local oversight of 3rd party partners, and communicating effectively with senior leadership and other internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with leadership goals and successful execution of local productions. . Assist international teams to source and analyze submissions based on slate goals, and provide local insights and feedback for senior leadership approval. . Support the U.S. based Amazon Studios team in relation to all internal film development and production processes such as greenlights, business reviews etc. . Coordinate and interface with external and internal business partners including but not limited to: marketing, business affairs, legal, PR, creative, production, and post-production teams to ensure all stages of a project's lifecycle are executed properly. . Serve as primary liaison between the U.S. based Amazon Studios team and a wide-range of external producers in Thailand. Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's degree and/or graduate degree or equivalent experience. . Extensive experience in both Development and Production, as a Producer or Commissioner with an in-depth knowledge of the Thai movie landscape. . Excellent communication and writing skills in both Thai and English. . Experience working with a broad network of creators, producers, production companies, writers and talent. Preferred Qualifications : . Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment. . Creative thinker with a passion for movies who is not limited by industry norms. . Curiosity in learning about various cultures and local markets. . High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information. . Creative problem-solver. . Positive, proactive and able to consistently exercise great judgement.

Job Description : Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects using the newest technology Would you like to gain the deepest customer and partner insights on maximizing the value of cloud computing technologies At AWS, we're hiring highly technical Cloud Consulting Consultants to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, AI/ML & DevOps transformations. . Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field business development, marketing, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Amazon Simple DB/RDS databases, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), etc. . Solutions - Define and deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in on-site visits with prospective customers, understanding customer requirements, and proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements. . Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services. . Insights - Work with AWS engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Basic Qualifications : . Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation . Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges . Highly technical and analytical, possessing 7 or more years of IT implementation experience . Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale . Experience with agile approaches and Experience in DevOps or DevSecOps . Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies required . Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, SOX, HIPPA etc.) . Current hands-on software development experience required Internet-related business models preferred . Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations . BS level technical degree required Computer Science or Math background preferred Preferred Qualifications : . Strong track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing environments. Integration of AWS cloud services with on-premise technologies from Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc. . Masters degree in Computer Science

Job Description : Job summary The Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) Enterprise marketing team is seeking a data-driven, hands-on and self-directed individual to drive the regional marketing strategy, plan and execution for the Telco industry. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role developing an important market segment within an exciting, fast growing business. This role requires the ability to execute against both the strategic marketing plans and campaigns, while being creative to design new and innovative ways to reach new audiences. This role also requires strong collaboration across functions including Sales, Business Development, SME's, Global and Field Marketing to develop and execute holistic marketing campaigns. Key job responsibilities * Develop a regional Telco marketing strategy designed to drive awareness, acquisition and engagement within target accounts. * Engage with sales leadership at various levels to ensure alignment on business priorities, marketing strategies, tactics and desired outcomes. * Create and execute high-impact, online and offline, Telco specific campaigns showcasing the value and differentiation of AWS services and solutions. * Deep dive and understand audience pain points to create insightful, action-driving content. * Continually experiment and introduce new approaches to marketing that engage customers in innovative ways. * Prioritise, manage and optimise marketing spend to deliver against KPIs. * Deliver detailed reporting and metrics on activity results, campaign effectiveness, and ROI. Use data to make real-time adjustments and proactively identify trends and opportunities. Basic Qualifications : * Held a similar marketing position within the technology Industry * Minimum 8+ years work experience in or with the Telco industry * Successful track record of building and executing audience specific marketing strategies with clear goals and objectives that align with business priorities and support revenue targets. * Consistently demonstrated success in hands-on programs and campaign execution, and project management. * Ability to work on multiple, simultaneous programs that require strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical execution. * Interested in building programs and processes from the ground up and comfortable in ambiguous environments. * Strong stakeholder engagement (internal and external) with the ability to influence. Preferred Qualifications : * Marketing experience working in rapid growth companies and industries * Knowledge about cloud computing market and technologies * Skill to use BI tools, Salesforce, Marketo and other digital marketing tools

Job Description : Partner Leader, Health Care and Life Sciences (HCLS), Global Accounts (BDSI) Would you like to lead a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a candidate to lead and manage our partnerships with management consulting firms and leading global and regional systems integrators. Do you have the business savvy and industry expertise necessary to position Amazon as the technology platform of the future As a Partner Leader within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share to help our Global customers accelerate their journey to the cloud. The Partner Leader will lead the Partner Strategy for the HCLS vertical with a team of senior Partner Success Managers. The Partner team ensures that: 1) customers and sales teams understand the value of partners and how to engage 2) a strategic plan is created for each account 3) partners have brand awareness and drive new customer demand 4) qualified partners are recommended for opportunities and deliver quality results and 5) partners know what is required for success in the industry. The successful leader will possess a technology sales and/or partner sales management background where they have demonstrated success in leading a customer-obsessed team that achieves its goals via a matrixed sales team environment. Further, they will have a demonstrated aptitude for hiring, training and developing the best to create a highly-effective and scalable team. They will be highly-motivated with demonstrated capabilities in defining and driving operational excellence within their team, well-defined plans that include features enabling quick identification of issues or successes, and the ability to spot trends that help our customers, partners and AWS succeed in their mutual goals. Roles & Responsibilities: Field Leadership: Operate as the single threaded owner of all activities, escalations and partner-led impact for the HCLS industry vertical. Performance Management: Maintain a high bar and ensure that expected contributions are delivered by the team, through ongoing coaching, feedback and development planning. Operational Excellence: Able to meet or exceed all operational aspects of the role to ensure team success. Further, the successful leader will have the Amazon Leadership Principle of Invent and Simplify as part of their operational tool kit and be able to identify opportunities to increase effectiveness and efficiency. Market Assessment for assigned territory: Assess the most effective use of partner's resources and drive operating models with sales and functional teams. Sales Contribution: Provide scale and increased sales capacity by leveraging the partner community to drive increased usage of AWS services through the development and execution of both sell-through and sell-with models. Project Delivery and Customer Success: Ensure that ongoing partner engagements are delivered to exceed customer expectations. Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work. Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. Basic Qualifications : . 5+ years management experience leading direct or partner sales . 5+ years knowledge and experience of the HCLS Sector . 7+ years partner sales, business development and partner management experience . Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives . Experience of working with Global Accounts . Exposure of working with Systems Integrators, Consulting Companies, and ISV's to drive sales . Possess presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences. Preferred Qualifications : . 7+ Years prior direct sales experience . Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics . Experience and familiarity with the AWS platform, products, solutions and capabilities . Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role . Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

We provide a vast range of furniture & home décor products each of which is designed & finished to the best of our ability. Our focus lies on aesthetics, finish & durability. We're looking for a Lead, Data Scientist to work onsite within our Digital Bank. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As a Lead, Data Scientist, you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers. Job Description Reporting to the Head of Data & Insights, you will join a multidisciplinary team to work on and solve many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working and build delightful high-quality products for our customers. We are looking for a Lead, Data Scientist for our Digital Bank in Singapore who can analyse large amount of raw information to derive insights to improve our company. We will also rely on you to build and improve data products with machine learning models. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. You will also be familiar with the agile practices and working in sprints with other data scientists and data engineers bring data use cases to life. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with high degrees of ambiguity, get excited by solving complex problems and are happy to roll your sleeves up and get things done. The Role Responsibility: . Build/implement enterprise level Data Hub, Dashboard/Reporting platform, Machine Learning environment, Analytics (Adobe, Google) with relevant stakeholders . Run and execute those platforms: o By creating predictive models and machine-learning algorithms for propensity to buy, churn prevention o By building and maintaining the behavioural segmentation o By delivering the dashboards and reports that make data actionable . Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data sources and data gathering techniques. . Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis . Extending company&rsquos data with third party sources of information when needed . Crunch, mine and analyse data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. . Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, other business outcomes. . Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques . Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. . Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner . Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance . Analyse large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns . Present information using data visualization techniques . Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges . Present proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions. Our Ideal Candidate: . 8-10 years of experience in manipulating data sets and building statistical models, ideally within a high growth Start up or within Financial services, with a Retail or Consumer banking focus. . Possesses a Master&rsquos or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field. . Experience in creating data architectures and ML frameworks. . Experience with a variety of machine learning techniques (supervised, unsupervised, anomaly detection, deep learning, NLP, RecSys etc) and understanding their real-world advantages / drawbacks. . Proven experience as a Data Scientist with past history of successfully delivering end-to-end data science projects (business understanding, EDA, modelling, deployment, monitoring, etc). . Experience using data science related languages/tools (Python, SQL, Spark, R etc) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. . Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Data Studio) and data frameworks (e.g. Google Big Query, Big Table, Data Flow) . Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, S3, Lambda, Sagemaker, EC2, etc) . Problem-solving aptitude . Have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. . Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. . Excellent communication and presentation skills . Experience in Agile ways of working and familiarity with tools like Jira, Confluence, Trello, Slack etc
