DESCRIPTION Job summary At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients. Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing. Would you like to be a central part of a recruiting team that is responsible for fueling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven recruiting leader that loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused recruiting expert to join our global recruiting organization supporting AWS. This role will be responsible for working closely with various business stakeholders to define the sourcing strategy, generate high caliber talents and close top candidates all within a fast-moving and super dynamic environment. You will have the opportunity to draw on your extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business and forge dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners. Key job responsibilities Core Responsibilities: Work closely with business in order to deeply understand teams organization structure, responsibilities, strengths/weaknesses and key business drivers. Utilize this information to develop most effective recruiting strategies. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through proactive market research and on-going relationship management, gauging chemistry of candidates for fit and motivation rather than simply sell a role. Meanwhile, manage to ensure all sourcing channels are sufficiently utilized, including but not limited to employee referrals, career portals, search firms, job fairs, etc. Consult on ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer. Also, articulated in writing recruiting plans with deliverables, timelines and a formal tracking process. Active participation in the full cycle recruiting efforts, including emphasis on the capability of assessment skills to help evaluating candidates and ensuring the highest bar. Lead final assessment and selection process. In charge of the offer proposal and negotiation process. Manage well on all the data associated with the recruitment process. Data-driven thinking and systematic approaches in achieving the operation excellence. Emphasis on continuous improvement, as such it is expected that you will spend time to ensure ongoing education of hiring managers and interviews on recruitment best practice and interview skills training. Implement the recruitment tools/systems in region through active collaboration with global contacts. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 6+ years experience in progressive recruiting with a heavy focus on sourcing and candidate generation . Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research. . Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships. . Demonstrated track record of continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customer. . Demonstrated ability to execute recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, and diversity sourcing. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . In-depth analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team. . Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member. . Experience in recruiting in the region Here at Amazon - . We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. . Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. . Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Local Unit & Position Description Are you the consultant who is looking for a new challenge? Do you want to support DNV’s customers to improve their asset management performance within the Energy sector? Then we have the job for you. As a Senior Consultant for Network Asset Management in DNV’s Power Grids APAC in Singapore and Asia Pacific, you will act as the trusted senior advisor to our customers and support them with solutions in optimizing their asset reliability and performance linking to their business drivers. The role will involve working along with other specialists within the organization to provide technical consulting services in the Power, Energy and Renewable sectors. The role also has business development responsibilities. This includes working within the team to establish long-term customer relationships, keeping abreast of industry needs and trends, as well as participation in industry events to ensure that DNV's service offerings are well-known and well-respected in the power and energy industry. You, as Senior Consultant, will work within a team of professionals where you will be responsible for the acquisition, management and execution of projects. You will analyse and give advice to customers on how to manage their assets in the most optimal and reliable way. Understanding the market, operating in, technical know-how, and delivering high quality contents are key characteristics of an Asset Management Consultant within our team. You, as an asset management specialist shall have knowledge of international standards in the field of Asset Management. You shall have in-depth knowledge of business processes related to asset management specifically to electrical utilities and industries. You will also: Lead and deliver projects related to Power System Asset Management and Asset Management processes for utilities or industries. Lead and deliver projects related to Business Process Improvements, Asset Management Decision Support, Maintenance Optimisation and Asset Lifecycle Management Have technical knowledge in the field of Power System Asset Diagnostics Participate to perform field tasks of Substation Diagnostics, Condition Assessment, analyse and interpret measurement- and diagnostic results obtained from field work for remaining life time determination and related recommendations Perform Power Failure Investigations Support with business development as a technical consultant Position Qualifications We’re looking for an enthusiastic team player who understands the technical and business consequences of a business decision as well as technical know-how on power system assets and can develop and maintain good relations with our customers. And: You have at 8 -10 years of experience in network asset management and power systems, preferably working in this field related to Electrical Utilities and/or Large Industries Master / Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Power Engineering from a recognized university are preferred. You have experience on working on establishing systems for asset management standards i.e ISO55000 at utility and/or large industry You have experience in mapping business processes, performing gap analysis, development of road maps and standard operating procedures for utilities or industry. You have good knowledge in operating and maintaining power system assets You have experience in performing asset failure root cause analysis. You know how to manage risks and have knowledge of capital components in electricity utilities and/or large industry. You can write clear and high-quality reports and commercial offers. Passionate about the power and energy industries as well as the field of asset management. You have a growing professional network in the power & energy industry. You have excellent English verbal & written communication skills, and with a second language proficiency will be preferred. You are available to travel regionally on a regular basis (up to 20%), if required. Your home office will be in Singapore Company & Business Area Description DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions. We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system. Equal Opportunity Statement DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity! Recommended Skills Asset Management Business Development Business Processes Communication Customer Relationship Management Diagnostic Skills

DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. Using AWS, companies can requisition compute power, storage, and other services - gaining access to a global computing infrastructure that is the backbone of Amazon.com's multi-billion dollar retail business. Today, AWS provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers millions of active monthly customers from start-ups to multi-national corporations to governments. This role is preferred to be located in Singapore but can also be based anywhere in APJC. At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our AWS APJC PXT as a Business Analyst. The individual will be an integral part of the PXT Business Operations Team and will report to the APJC PXT Principal Project Manager, based in Singapore. The Business Analyst is responsible for anticipating and answering business questions related to the AWS APJC workforce. You will curate business reviews and insights around the AWS APJC workforce, enabling AWS APJC to better attract, engage, and develop employees. This will require you to be well versed in the latest AWS technology and business practices to generate workforce insights in region. Key job responsibilities . Generate business review metrics and documents to inform business and HR leaders progress to people-related goals . Understand the business at its core and use that understanding to generate various business insights . Designing and building customized data solutions for business and HR leaders that scale . Field and resolve various ad hoc analytical needs for business and HR leaders . Administer an intake framework for effective prioritization and development of data needs . Partner with engineering peers to document best practices in data visualization, data analysis, and user training . Partner with Global AWS PXT People Analytics Team to advocate designing and building a system that will serve the needs of the region . Work on ad hoc data projects that will come up on an as needed basis The ideal candidate: . Is independent, creative and self-driven with the ability to work in a highly ambiguous environment with minimal guidance . Is analytical with the ability to work with data using good judgment . Possesses strong aptitude towards data and problem-solving skills . Is customer-obsessed (i.e. thinks about the needs of PXT team, employees, and the business) and work backwards from these needs . Is able to multi-task and prioritize competing requests from different stakeholders . Possesses a can-do spirit . Is attentive to details and insists on the highest standards . Has exceptional writing and communications skills . Able to operate in a lean, fast-paced, entrepreneurial, multi-cultural environment BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 5+ years of experience working with complex data sources and/or data engineering teams . 3+ years of SQL experience . 5+ years operating in an agile/scrum environment . Demonstrated experience anticipating business need and providing relevant business insights . Demonstrated experience generating user facing documentation and communications . Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related technical/engineering field . Excellent writing and communication skills PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Expert-level knowledge of SQL . Certified scrum master . Working knowledge of AWS tech stack. Glue, Redshift, S3, Quicksight, and Sagemaker may be used in this role. Overview of job MediaCom is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for an Associate Media Manager to join us. In this role, you will drive strategy and innovation in communication planning, own campaign development and lead key clients’ relationship. At GroupM APAC, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us. Reporting of the role This role reports to: Account Director 3 best things about the job: Working with a high performing integrated media team to drive best in class channel planning and ROI. Hone leadership skills through building and leading operation excellence for the team. A culture built on collective energy, passion, collaboration and support. In this role, your goals will be: In three months: Build good rapport with clients. Proactively participate in meeting discussions with clients and agency partners. Acquire a good understanding of planning framework and how it can be applied to build an effective campaign strategy and channel plan. Own projection management, ensure smooth workflow and clients and team members are up to speed on all tasks. Rigor in setting and tracking campaign KPIs. Ensure effective and accurate optimisation and delivery of performance utilising all relevant internal teams, agency processes and tech. In six months: Establish credibility by applying understanding of clients’ category/competitive landscape and marketing priorities in day to day work. Actively lead meeting discussions with clients and agency partners. Holistic thinking is carried across channel planning, including how paid owned earned interplay in the communication ecosystem. Direct and mentor the team to drive operation excellence throughout project implementation. In 12 months: Build trusted advisory relationship with clients. Able to support the broader strategic output for clients’ marcom needs. Fully competent in developing and articulating a compelling strategy/approach to successfully sell in new initiatives to drive incremental revenue. Lead and direct all team members to support in the development of channel plans and creative solutions that are planned holistically with the broader media mix. What your day job looks like: Develop compelling campaign solutions including consumer and category insights, strategy, channel recommendation. Drive strategic and tactical innovation across traditional and digital platforms. Hands-on project management – collaborate with media owners, agency partners and internal specialist teams to ensure all deliverables are met/launched on time. Evolve use of measurement systems to provide greater insight into ROI of media plans and ensure the team deliver on agreed KPIs. What you’ll bring: Strong working experience of how traditional and digital (including social) channels interplay in the Singapore media ecosystem Innovative and effective campaign solutions Leadership skills in building and leading operation excellence for the team Minimum qualifications: Currently living/working in Singapore. At least 3-4 years’ of experience in media or digital agency where your key function includes the development of campaign/channel strategy A creative thinker who constantly seeks new ideas/inspirations to bring fresh perspectives to client work. A confident communicator and eloquent in presenting/selling-in ideas to clients and agency partners. Working knowledge of digital buying and trading tech including social ad managers, ad-servers, verification tools and DSP/DMPs etc. About MediaCom Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators. Founded in 1986 and established in Japan for over 10 years, we have grown to become 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries. We are proud to be recognised as the Japan Media Agency of the Year in both 2017 and 2018 with a Silver Award in 2019. With clients including Adidas, Mars, SK-II, Dell, The Coca-Cola Corporation, Cartier, IKEA, Peugeot and Citroen, working at MediaCom is a gateway to working with leading global brand organisations and connecting to people across the planet. But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy. Our focus is on providing long term, rewarding careers and we know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients. We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why our agencies are open environments that celebrate difference and have built in flexibility that reflects the many different ways in which people work and succeed. And its why we actively encourage participation in our Global Mobility programme with opportunities to live and work around the world. We are super connected and our employees contribute to and shape the working environment, from promoting work-life balance and well-being to organising team events and celebrations. Do you want to work with smart, creative, connected and enthusiastic people in a stable and rewarding environment? So do we. Welcome to MediaCom. About GroupM Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Job_Descriptions: Kantar Insights Division Consultant, Brand Guidance Singapore Are you curious and enthusiastic about brands? Do you want to learn how to build iconic brands that achieve financial growth in the market? Interested to know how advertising, media and everything that a brand does impact purchase? Why do people love some brands and not others? This is an exciting opportunity join the Brand Guidance domain in Insights Division, Kantar Singapore, working with a team of passionate brand builders to build significant impact on our client’s businesses. You will lead a strong team to deliver successful Brand Growth Programs and connecting various data sources to deliver important insights and stories. As a key interface between Kantar and our clients, the role includes client engagement, consultancy, study design and analysis, driving preparation of presentations and reports. You will be leading a small team of two to four team members who will support your operational and storytelling excellence. As an emerging leader, you will get to hone your leadership skills by learning how to elevate the skills of your team members, lead resources effectively and develop the careers of your line reports. You will also support the implementation of broader business initiatives sought at redefining the way we work and deepening the domain knowledge of the wider Brand Guidance team. If you have a curiosity about understanding brands and encouraging growth in people and businesses, this is the role for you! Apply to us now. The Role: Project & Account Management Effectively manage and mentor junior team to ensure multiple project & account results are met. Deliverables including questionnaires, data, dashboards and reports. Maximise account efficiency by:Reviewing, improving, streamlining & automating processes without compromising quality Resourcing and planning project timelines to meet client objectives within budgets Foster good relationships with onshore and offshore teams and provide constructive feedback to improve speed of delivery Ensure Finance processes (client contracts, PO and billing) are followed through for all projects Analysis and Insights Expertise Understand and synthesise data from various sources (e.g. sales data, media spend data), and making use of analytics where needed Translate insights into engaging stories with clear and concise implications that will help clients make better decisions Demonstrate knowledge of Kantar’s brand philosophies and apply these appropriately to the design & analysis Find opportunities to deepen insights for clients using further analysis including case studies and meta learnings as appropriate Client Management and Consultancy Building strong relationships with key client partners Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of your clients and their business objectives to offer advice and support Leading client discussions at briefings, regular project meetings and presentations Present confidently and impactfully in client presentations Provide a point of view on specific client issues aligned with brand philosophies Develop and implement account management plans for key clients with support from Directors Conduct and create impact reviews for all presentations People Management & Development Manage and develop a successful and engaged team of 2-4 team members Work with line reports to identify and set clear objectives to develop and nurture their careers Participate in the training of more junior team members as appropriate Complete all Performance Appraisals Process responsibilities on time Business Development Identify and pursue opportunities to grow existing client business, revenue and profitability Respond to new business opportunities by understanding the brief and preparing proposals Review account and project profitability to understand opportunities to improve financial performance for future projects Ensure that Direct Costs are within the budget Key relationships: Unit Leader: Client Partner Be responsible for developing your research, brand & commercial competence to support client consultations and team development. In turn, you are accountable for delighting clients and driving account profitability through excellence in operations and insights delivery. Domain Leader: Head of Brand Guidance: The Domain leader will support you in understanding and implementing the Kantar offer, frameworks and protocols to reflect the best of our expertise. Be responsible for staying connected to the internal teams on your accounts and ensure our projects reflect the best client & domain practices globally. Team: Analysts and Associates Effectively distribute tasks and responsibilities, while supporting any obstacles in project execution with project management teams. Manage the growth of juniors your team through regular career conversations with support from your Business Unit Leader. Clients: Insights and Marketing teams at client organizations Discover and understand the client’s brand & business challenges, and deliver compelling data stories to help their brands achieve financial growth. Lead client induction webinars to embed our philosophy into their organisations Skills & Experience Required: Desire to work in a highly exciting, fast-paced, and changing environment Proven track record to handle multiple workstreams and projects at the same time Critical thinking and problem solving skills Has a passion for discovering stories and patterns hidden in data sets Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build and manage relationships with partners of all levels At least one year of experience in people management is an advantage Join us At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics. PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (“Kantar”). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is vital for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com.

ABOUT MEDIACOM We believe in People First, Better Results. MediaCom unleashes brands’ growth by helping them See the Bigger Picture. This means that we apply our unique ‘Systems Thinking’ philosophy and technology to all marketing levers: media, message and data. As a result, we design communication strategies that deliver short term results and help brands build for the future. As part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, and GroupM, WPP’s consolidated media investment management arm, we have access to the richest data, most robust benchmarks and most advanced capabilities in the market. This helps us provide comprehensive solutions to all marketing challenges. Our success is underpinned by our long-standing ‘People First, Better Results’ belief. We know that by investing in our people’s whole-person wellbeing, careers and capabilities, we will help grow our clients’ businesses. In 2020 this approach led MediaCom to be crowned Global Media Network of the Year by Eurobest and Festival of Media Global, in addition to being the most awarded agency at the WARC Media Awards. Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. Job_Descriptions: Responsibilities: Develop and innovate critical CMOS/interconnect module. Drive multi-functional teams to optimize existing process flows and develop new innovative solutions to meet product requirements and manufacturability. Develop/re-define critical specifications criteria for optimum product performance and drive activities to get them to manufacturing process capability. Extract and analyze inline, probe, parametric, reliability, and other critical metrics and predict future behavior of the CMOS device performance of the product to enable early innovative solutions to meet product and device specifications. Early introduction, characterization and validation of new CMOS device models and test structures for developing future NAND products. 3 dimensions analysis with the use of K2 view to extract layout information and combine with the doping profiles of each implant step for product development and integration solutions. Interact and collaborate with TCAD, modeling, and layout teams to drive clearer definition of CMOS device and reliability improvements across multiple tech-nodes and designs. Coordinate activities at manufacturing site towards gating experiment funding, conversions, and effectively communicate decisions made to all R&D, manufacturing, and relevant partners. Take on leadership role at quarterly yield summits and monthly program reviews in summarizing complex problems, deriving and explaining actions taken to address them and getting R&D, manufacturing, and senior management teams on the same page. Assist in the transfer of a new technology from R&D to manufacturing and contribute towards ensuring successful ramp and qualification. Supporting the transfer, documentation and training of module fundamentals into manufacturing. Requirements: MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering preferably specialized in Microelectronics and Semiconductor Device Physics. Prior technology development and tech transfer/manufacturing experiences are preferred. Fresh MS/PhD candidates with knowledge of semiconductor process Integration, device physics and CMOS engineering. Direct fab experience with nonvolatile memories manufacturing, knowledge of TCAD, K2 view layout, and NAND product are highly desirable. Ability to develop a strong, holistic, end-to-end understanding of CMOS device and its related module on NAND technologies, related structural and electrical fail mechanisms. Deep understanding of probe failure mechanism, ability to do electrical bench data collection. Self-motivated, self-governing with proven ability to work in a demanding and dynamic environment. Experienced in coordinating cross-functional teams to achieve a goal. Solid data analysis, communication and reporting abilities with demonstrated presentation abilities. Curiosity and natural tendency of learning new things independently. Ability to travel for extended periods of time to the US for collaborative R&D work.

Expected to work and collaborate with teams from US, EU & APAC regions.

DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES: As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You’ll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment—one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. The Macro eTrading team partners with several Rates and Emerging Markets (EM) businesses to provide solutions for electronic trading on client markets. We are based predominantly in London and NYC but also maintain a presence in Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney and Mumbai, and the businesses we support span the globe. We cover several functional domains including pricing, contribution, execution, and STP, and manage the entire SDLC. As such, we are a diverse group of project managers, business analysts, and developers (front-end and back-end). Our systems facilitate the electronic trading of many products on the client markets, the majority of which are securities and derivatives. We are looking for a developer to work on several exciting projects for the Rates and EM businesses in APAC. The projects cover both BAU and transformation initiatives, touching everything from pricing to STP, from the front-end to the back-end. The ideal candidate would have experience working in development in markets, either at an investment bank or something similar. Other relevant development experience, however, will be considered. The candidate must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and be able to work with a geographically diverse team. Responsibilities • Understand requirements, solve technical problems, propose complete solutions • Design, develop and test software following standard SDLC • Support PMs, BAs and management as technical SME • Define and implement non-functional requirements • Help team identify improvements to make to our systems and processes This role a requires wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: • BS/BA degree • Minimum 7 years of work experience, in which minimum 5 years in Finance IT industry • Minimum 5 years hands-on development working experience in Java / Python / C++, SQL, Unix, Spring • Professional experience on Trading application in Fixed-Income, Macro, Equities, Credit • Professional experience working with Traders, Sales and Operation • Understanding on the below is required: + Multi-Threading + Socket Programming couple + Connectivity Protocols, like FIX + Low-Latency event-driven systems + Front-end technologies like C#, JavaScript, HTML5, Angular + Design Patterns and Software Architectures • Energetic, motivated and determined • Pragmatic and results-oriented • Adaptable to diverse set of technical responsibilities • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills • Productive and able to manage time effectively • Knowledge in the below will be preferred: + Electronic trading systems + TIBCO RV, LBM, JMS or other messaging middleware + KDB+ or other tick databases + Distributed caches To apply for this position, please use the following URL: https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=8628eb470ee96ca9f19f7b90a48a0402

Job_Title: Restructuring and Forensic Associate / Senior Associate

Ability to work independently, communicate effectively and possess strong interpersonal skills. Proficiency in both written and spoken English.

Job_Descriptions: Responsibilities Develop and optimize unit processes to meet the yield and quality requirements of advanced NAND part type Quantify benefits of innovative process and/or equipment solutions to enable early experimentation and adoption for process margin improvement Prioritize within Singapore based manufacturing Wet Etch team on the key technology issues that need TD breakthroughs. Integrate and troubleshoot processes as part of cross-functional teams driving yield and quality improvement Participate with Boise TD Films peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology device needs into clear process requirements Identify disruptive processes early on and work with manufacturing and Boise TD to identify viable path forward Process development will include performing fundamental research, hardware evaluations, as well as testing processes for novel applications and generating intellectual property relevant to Micron. Initiate and manage experiments to widen process margins as well as to test out manufacturability of next node solutions Identify process simplification opportunities and drive cross functional teams in implementation Incorporate best known manufacturing methods into early development phase of upcoming nodes. Design and implement advanced process monitoring and control methodologies. Serve as a technical expert within Micron contributing to technical projects for improvements to processes, procedures and equipment. Lead team or sites or suppliers on complex, multi-disciplinary projects in quality focused meetings, process and yield improvement meetings, cost and productivity improvement meetings Provide advice and counsel to management on significant technical issues. Leads and initiate innovation projects through patents/technical papers. This position requires communications and collaboration with partners both locally and globally. Strict adherence to Micron Intellectual Property protection policy is a must. Be part of the continuous worldwide TD engagement with suppliers pushing for breakthrough solutions. Requirements Bachelors/Masters/PhD graduates in Materials Science, Chemical/Microelectronic Engineering or Chemistry are welcomed to apply. A deep understanding of chemistry, chemical kinetics, thermodynamics and mass transport Basic understanding of films and interface engineering and analysis techniques thereof – SIMS, XPS, EDX, SEM/TEM, FTIR. Understanding of various integration and structural impacts and constraints related to wet etch processes. An understanding of the general process steps and process flow for memory processing, planar and vertical NAND memory in particular. Working knowledge of data analysis systems e.g.: Y3 to facilitate analysis of experimental data Working knowledge of Design of Experiments (DoE) Proven ability to collaborate with local and overseas teams on projects Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to convey the message in concise and effective manner both in local as well as remote communications. Ability to be a self-motivated individual and be adaptable to Micron’s changing needs in terms of working extended hours, if required Proven ability to work in a demanding & dynamic environment and able to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously Ability to travel for extended periods of time and stay at Boise TD for 2-4 months at a stretch to work on technology development.

About us PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally. Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organisations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We care about our World We act with Courage We Share , it’s in our DNA We choose Positivity We Deliver Awesomeness Your profile & responsibilities YOU: Does building and delivering innovative web / mobile business solutions excite you? If you answered yes then you might be the person we're looking for! Do you also: Thrive on tough challenges. When was the last time you failed and how did you respond? Seek out learning opportunities. What are you up to right now? Adapt to constant change. When were you last surprised? Have the mastery over at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats? If you answered yes to all, then this could be the start of something special. YOU AGAIN: We are offering an exciting opportunity for a Senior Software Engineer (Solution Architecture) to join our innovative, fun and dynamic team. You’ll work alongside our Tech Hive to initiate development, carry out scoping estimations, implement architecture designs and write architecture documents. You will assist our customers in adopting best practices in new architecture patterns. We are looking for someone who is passionate about new technologies and digital innovation. Ideally an individual who is resourceful, detail oriented, looking for the excitement that comes from working hard - and wants to work with a team who feels the same way. Your work will make a direct impact on to the social, environmental and purpose driven objectives and initiatives of PALO IT in order to positively impact our environment, customers, communities and ourselves as an organization and individual. Help clients in defining end to end architecture that helps their business improve scalability and resiliency and drive implementation efficiency. Help to identify and document the common architectural patterns across projects Able to guide conversations with clients and delivery teams from ideation through to deployment to ensure a rich and effective client experience Strong critical thinker with problem solving aptitude. Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. Technical delivery across the entire software lifecycle with hands-on experience on technologies. Capability to handle the in-depth technical conversations whilst keeping the bigger picture in mind. About Us PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity, and open collaboration while having fun doing it. Started in France in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Australia, Hong Kong, Thailand, and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel, and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more! Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organizations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We Care about our World We Act with Courage We Share , it’s in our DNA We Choose Positivity & Self-Improvement We Deliver Awesomeness Your profile & responsibilities YOU: Thrive on challenge. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: The Data Architect will work on designing and implementing Big Data solutions, with a focus on acquisition, storage, governance, and processing of huge sets of structured/unstructured data. In addition, you will be responsible for designing end-to-end data pipelines, from ingestion all the way to automated ML model training and deployment. You will bring a vision of the Big Data solutions landscape for choosing optimal architecture components to use for these purposes as well as a set of data engineering skills for implementing enterprise data foundation such as data lake. Finally, you will work closely with other PALO IT experts in Data Intelligence, Research, UX Design, Digital Technology, and Agile teams to enable intelligence in the digital mesh of our clients and deliver a big impact to them. Understand the business context of a client, and design end-to-end solutions, which fit the client’s needs When required, work with our Sales team during the pre-sales process to create proposals for potential clients Identify and implement big data frameworks/components that best fit to requirements Gather and process data at scale, tackling challenges coming from unstructured data, real-time processing, data quality, etc. Enable data management capabilities to govern enterprise data/metadata and provide easy and secure access to them Support the definition and optimization of the underlying infrastructure YOUR PROFILE: You hold a Bachelor, Master, or Ph.D. degree in IT, Information Management, Computer Science, or relevant field You have more than 8 years of experience in the data industry with at least 4 years experience with Big Data tools Good knowledge of big data technology landscape and concepts related to distributed storage/computing Experience with big data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) and distributions (Databricks, Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR) Experience with batch ETL jobs to ingest and process data from multiple data sources Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g. Postgres, SQL Server, Cassandra, MongoDB, Neo4J, ElasticSearch) Experience in data modeling Experience with querying tools (e.g Hive, Spark SQL, Impala) Experience with real-time stream processing, using solutions such as Kafka, AWS Kinesis, Flume, and/or Spark Streaming Experience with ML model lifecycle management and relevant tools (e.g MLflow) Experience with designing the right infrastructure for the right services (e.g knowing when to use containerized solutions) Experience in cloud offerings from the major cloud providers, such as AWS, Azure, GCP Experience with ConnectedLife’s Digital Health Solutions Connect the Care Continuum; reinventing the way global organisations connect with the people they care about to continuously plan, manage, monitor and help improve their health and wellbeing; wherever they are; 24-7-365. Our powerful data-driven solutions combine advanced sensory, analytics, AI and communications technologies – including consumer-friendly wearables (such as Fitbit’s smart health watches and trackers), IoT/medical devices (including biosensor patches), smartphone mobile apps and customisable web dashboards – to capture and analyse user activity, health vitals and wellness data and enable care teams to collaborate seamlessly and work together with patients to better manage their health and wellbeing based on their unique risks, health status and wellness goals. You will work with members of the Product team in Singapore and be responsible for applying machine learning / AI techniques on massive data from all parts of our business to benefit and enhance our products in innovative ways. You will take an active and hands-on role in supporting the product creation and development teams, and will report to the Chief Product Officer based in Singapore. Our ideal candidate is a team player who thrives in a small, dynamic team environment and is able to work independently, whether in the office or remotely from home. You will be committed, energetic and proactive. You’ll also love creating innovative solutions, solving problems, and feel passionate about wanting your work to make a difference. ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES Build statistical and machine learning models to analyse and predict health outcomes and user behaviour Design new machine learning systems to power the analytics efforts. Develop algorithms and tools that will be integrated for analysing medical conditions of a patient like walking pattern and motor state with the help of raw data collected from various types of health sensors. Understand and evaluate a variety of AI models from our potential partners, to see how we can add value to these models and if they fit into our product strategy. Contribute to continuous improvement and proactively support knowledge sharing across the product delivery team. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and develop efficient models. SKILLS / EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS Degree level education in Mathematics, Scientific, Computing or Engineering discipline or equivalent experience with substantial years of experience at various levels of Data Science roles and prior experience leading a small team of data scientists An ability to apply logical, analytical and innovative thinking on a range of technical problems, with a particular bias towards the application of existing analytical methods, the development of new methods development and software engineering. Particular experience with predicative analytics, advanced analytics and reinforced learning algorithms and other forms of machine learning is essential. Ability to interpret complex business requirements, translating them into analytical problems and delivering high value outputs. A medical background or a general understanding of medical and health terminology and concepts is a plus. Ideally with experience in applying AI to these fields (generating balanced datasets for training and evaluation of the models, ensuring data quality and identifying factors that could compromise this, identification and removal of data artefacts). Experience in the use of one or more current analytical / big data technologies such as Python (including relevant libraries), Azure (Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factories etc), Spark, SQL, Tableau, Power BI is essential. Tools: Python, SQL, REST, Keras, Tensorflow, SciKit learn, additional ML and DL frameworks. Environments: experience with GPU-based DevBox hardware, Edge devices with GPU/Tensorcores/NeuralEngine like Nvidia Jetson family or alike, streaming. Passionate to use all aspects of data science, machine learning, and technology to build the investment app of the future. Strong sense of ownership and accountability, with good attention to detail. Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well in an international team environment. Ability to be agile and flexible in adapting in a dynamic environment. Experience in working with medical devices and sensors is a plus, with particular focus on: accelerometer, gyroscope, PPG, electrodermal activity, and skin temperature data. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate solutioning and stakeholder management skills. Keep abreast with competitive landscape and new trends. Positive attitude / Confidence to take up tasks / provide reasonable timelines to complete tasks.

Job_Title: Senior Account Delivery Manager - Delivery Lead #sgunitedjobs
Job_Descriptions: About us PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally. Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organisations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We care about our World We act with Courage We Share , it’s in our DNA We choose Positivity We Deliver Awesomeness Your profile & role on the project YOU: Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you fail? Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now? Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised? Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats? YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Project responsibilities Responsible for the whole of a project/program, from inception through to completion: Is responsible for the full delivery. Act as a strategic liaison between senior client stakeholders, the project/program team and the Sales team. Collaborate with internal teams to shape and define business proposals and statements of work. Is accountable for the P&L of each project/program she or he is involved with. A hybrid of Project/Program Manager and Product Manager roles that would require a very high level of flexibility to adapt to the different parties involved, from the development team to the tech leads, to the Scrum master, product owner, business and technology stakeholders. Be able to objectively look at the constraints and pain points encountered by both our team and clients in order to steer the project into the right direction. Should be able to shield our team in order to create the most optimal environment for them in terms of productivity (quality before quantity) but should also be able to push the team to deliver within the timelines established while still adhering to our Palo way of doing things (values and delivery model). Previous experience as a team lead and excellent mentoring skills. Account Management Work hand in hand with the account manager to leverage on their knowledge and relationship with the clients to best handle the delivery objectives (on time, on budget). Understand clients needs and proactively identify new business opportunities. Grow key relationships across the clients global and regional areas of enterprise. Participate in business reviews to display strategic growth and areas of opportunity. PALO IT Is the Guardian & Ambassador of our Vision and Values. Encourage a fearless, entrepreneurial approach to solving problems. Lead a talented group of professionals, facilitating a culture of inclusion and support. Delivery Model & Approach Work hand in hand with our Sales team to ensure our clients have a deep understanding of our delivery model and that our approach is well explained / detailed in our proposals / project team structure. Have a good understanding of the challenges a Digital / Agile transformation would mean for our clients and be able to assess at a high level their maturity. Help the different hives to adopt our delivery model by establishing the awareness and helping out with the training plans. Touch base on a regular basis with the different hive masters / tech leads at Palo to keep the Delivery Model/Engine up to date with the best practices specific to each stream. Lead clients towards industry best practices. YOUR PROFILE: You have proven experience of 5 to 10 years in a similar position, with at least 5 years of experience managing projects/programs using Agile and Scrum methodologies/concepts. You mastered Scrum, XP, or Lean and a certification (certified Scrum master/Scrum practitioner) is good to have. You have good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency. You understand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team. You understand incremental delivery and the value of metrics. You understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition. You have knowledge of the software development lifecycle. You have excellent communication skills in English in written and spoken form. Your role at PALO IT You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company. If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you! About Us PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Bangkok and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more! Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organizations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We care about our World We act with Courage We Share, it’s in our DNA We choose Positivity We Deliver Awesomeness Your Profile & Role on the Project YOU: Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed? Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now? Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised? Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats? YOU AGAIN: You will use your talents in software development, application architecture, design thinking and problem solving to help create rapid prototypes and enable the rapid acceleration of ideas. You will have outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to manage client projects and build a high performing engineering team that consistently exceeds expectations. You will also work closely with project teams and business stakeholders and provide technical expertise that enables innovation. Provide full-stack expertise to the engineering team and establish best practices on code quality and performance. Lead and mentor engineers to deliver high-quality codes and projects. Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and designers to build great applications. Build confidence in our project delivery through automated testing, continuous integration, monitoring, and analytics. Provide architecture-level and code-level feedback for the engineering team. Shepherd technical decision-making process and provide technical roadmap and thought-leadership. STILL YOU: You are a creative individual with deep technological expertise, business acumen, and software development background. You must be able to communicate well with both internal and external parties with a good sense of idealism and pragmatism. You are endlessly curious, a self-starter and able to quickly grasp and understand a wide variety of software environments and solutions. You have done recruitment and have led/mentored an engineering team. You are interested in designing scalable, reliable and secure software using a combination of different languages, frameworks, libraries and technical environments. You have at least 2 years of hands-on experience in ReactJS and 10 years of experience in Frontend Javascript/CSS/ HTML (ES6, Angular, React, Vue, Redux) and Backend development using NodeJS, GoLang, .NET, Java, Spring, SpringBoot with 3 years of experience in client management. Experience in mobile development (Swift for IOS, Android, native or hybrid) is a bonus. You have strong experience with dB design and application - both relational and NoSQL You have in-depth experience in API development, using REST, GraphQL or SOAP. You have deep experience with the developer toolchain, in particular, npm, SCSS/SASS, Webpack, Web Assembly, Bash, Ant, and the Command line. You like to work in all phases of a rapid product development lifecycle: You are familiar with Agile Methodologies, Scrum, Kanban, and interested in learning more about Design Thinking, Lean Start-up, TDD, BDD, or XP. Your role at PALO IT You will be part of a project team working at various client sites, building or enhancing complex applications in the digital domain and serving as a touchstone for clients around agile development, best practices and emerging technologies. You will use your skills and experience to teach others and take advantage of opportunities to learn and improve your own skill sets. You will also be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company. In addition, you will contribute to the social, environmental and purpose driven objectives and initiatives of PALO IT in order to positively impact our environment, customers, communities and ourselves as an organization and individual. If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you! YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Acting as Scrum master for scrum teams with a focus on guiding the teams towards improving the way they work. Facilitating discussion, decision-making process, and conflict resolution. Facilitate sprint planning, retrospective, and demos. Assisting and educating the product owner with keeping the backlog groomed. Ensuring cross-team coordination. Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity. Maintaining relevant metrics that help the team see how they are doing. Coaching and mentoring other scrum masters in our product team. Ensuring that our ways of working are consistent across the teams. Guiding the team on self-organizing to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks Liaising between the developers and User Experience designers. Fostering better communication between the disciplines. Acting as a project manager when necessary. Take responsibility for managing dependencies between our team and third parties or between our team and other scrum teams. Strengthening the presence of our team as an Agile center of excellence. Actively contribute to the company’s Agile and Lean Community. Keep the rest of the company network aware of our activities. Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information. YOUR PROFILE: You have proven experience of 3 to 5 years in a similar position, with at least 2 years of experience managing projects using Agile and Scrum methodologies/concepts. You mastered SCRUM, XP, or Lean and is a certified scrum master/scrum practitioner. You have an excellent IT culture and a real sense of delivery. You have good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency. You understand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team. You understand incremental delivery and the value of metrics. You understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition. You have knowledge of the software development life-cycle. You have excellent communication skills in English in written and spoken form. You have previous experience as a team lead and excellent mentoring skills. Novelship is Asia’s fastest growing online marketplace for authentic, limited edition sneakers, apparel, and collectibles from the exclusive brands like Air Jordan, Yeezy, Supreme, Palace, Bearbrick, and more! Every item purchased or sold on Novelship is guaranteed to be 100% authentic. NS Digital is the digital arm of Novelship, which is focusing on building new business in the NFT/Digital Assets/Blockchain/Cryptocurrency space. We are looking for a Head of Marketing (NS Digital) to build our brand through community connection, driving awareness and building engagement amongst new and existing consumers. The successful candidate thinks creatively on how to use the power of experiential, influencers, brand partnerships and product releases to drive our growth in the NFT/Digital Assets marketplace. The candidate is highly collaborative, working closely with our Leadership, Engineering, Product Managers, Partnership teams to execute our go-to-market strategy. The candidate is highly passionate in sneakers and a proven cultural connector. This role will report to our Chief Executive Officer, and will be based in Singapore ideally, while open to candidates from all locations. The successful hire will also be entitled to the company’s Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP). Our Expectations: Define a clear Marketing strategy and position for NS Digital, including Digital Content, Advertising, Communications and Creative. Provide leadership and direction to manage the Social Community, Talent & Influencer, Brand & Strategic Partnerships, Experiential and Brand Direct product releases Build, manage and own seamless communication of cultural calendar to help enforce timely execution and coordinate across internal and external resources Oversee execution and alignment of the PR and communication strategy across owned, earned and paid media Tracking of the wider NFT market scene and monitoring competitor activities and their marketing initiatives Keep up with the trends, lead performance marketing and social media teams to execute on online marketing campaigns and use metrics-driven measurements to deliver the best outcome, optimise budget in each marketing channel Manage go-to-market for new features and products. This includes product launch in partnership with various cross-functional teams and driving product adoption among customers. Identify new audience segments within our existing user base to target as well as focusing on emerging market trends and opportunity sizing. Requirements: Degree in communication, marketing or related field 8+ years experience in a leadership role in digital marketing, growth marketing, and content / storytelling, preferably within the blockchain, NFT, gaming and/or related tech industries Experience in full funnel marketing campaign strategy, management and budget planning, managing a team of social media specialist, digital designer and community managers, influencers and performance marketing agencies/vendors Experience in generating content to acquire and nurture new consumers/fans through engagement and retention tactics Experience planning and leading community initiatives (e.g. building an online forum, launching an ambassador program, creating an event series) Experience in leading a culturally diverse team Good understanding of social media KPIs, best practices and analytical skills Detail-oriented, excellent follow through, ability to multitask, manage projects and workflow Excellent verbal communication skills, writing skills, interpersonal and presentations skills. Motivated, self-starter, independent problem-solver & resourceful
