Job_Title: Senior Account Delivery Manager - Senior Scrum Master #SGUnitedJobs
Job_Descriptions: About us PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally. Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organisations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We care about our World We act with Courage We Share , it’s in our DNA We choose Positivity We Deliver Awesomeness Your profile & role on the project YOU: Do you: Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed? Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now? Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised? Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats? If you answered yes to all, then this could be the start of something special. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Acting as Scrum master for scrum teams with a focus on guiding the teams towards improving the way they work. Facilitating discussion, decision-making process, and conflict resolution. Facilitate sprint planning, retrospective, and demos. Assisting and educating the product owner with keeping the backlog groomed. Ensuring cross-team coordination. Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity. Maintaining relevant metrics that help the team see how they are doing. Coaching and mentoring other scrum masters in our product team. Ensuring that our ways of working are consistent across the teams. Guiding the team on self-organizing to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks Liaising between the developers and User Experience designers. Fostering better communication between the disciplines. Acting as a project manager when necessary. Take responsibility for managing dependencies between our team and third parties or between our team and other scrum teams. Strengthening the presence of our team as an Agile center of excellence. Actively contribute to the company’s Agile and Lean Community. Keep the rest of the company network aware of our activities. Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information. YOUR PROFILE: You have proven experience of 3 to 5 years in a similar position, with at least 2 years of experience managing projects using Agile and Scrum methodologies/concepts. You mastered SCRUM, XP, or Lean and is a certified scrum master/scrum practitioner. You have an excellent IT culture and a real sense of delivery. You have good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency. You understand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team. You understand incremental delivery and the value of metrics. You understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition. You have knowledge of the software development life-cycle. You have excellent communication skills in English in written and spoken form. You have previous experience as a team lead and excellent mentoring skills. Your role at PALO IT You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company. If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you! We might not be able to get back to every applicant, but we promise your application will be reviewed by one of our recruitment experts. PALO IT Singapore is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Palo IT SG does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law. Job Description : The Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) develops high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance the competitiveness of Singapore’s manufacturing industry. SIMTech is looking for a motivated, independent, and innovative quick learner with excellent interpersonal - skills to join the Additive Manufacturing Group (AMG) at SIMTech (A*STAR), supporting Innovation Factory Built Lab. The successful candidate will have opportunities to participate in research and industry projects in additive manufacturing (AM), also known as 3D printing. The engineers at SIMTech have access to the state-of-the art manufacturing equipment and resources, and will work in a highly collaborative and dynamic R&D environment. The engineer will work on AM technologies like Fused Filament Fabrication (FFF), Stereolithography (SLA), Selective Laser Sintering (SLS), Selective Laser Melting (SLM) etc. and will support industry partners with their prototyping and printing needs. The engineer will also work closely with the designers at Innovation Factory to design for manufacturability and fabricate high value components for industry partners. The engineer will coordinate post-processing efforts for the 3D printed components and will be trained in the relevant printing process skills and material characterization skills. Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or materials science. Knowledge and experience in AM processes, design and characterization of printed parts, post-processing skills will be an added advantage. Good knowledge and experience in 3D CAD modelling. Ability to work effectively and independently in a team. Self-motivated with positive work attitude. Ability to prioritize and manage workload, and meet critical project deadlines. Strong communication, writing and presentation skills. The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Senior Information Technology Security Expert - Senior DevSecOps Engineer #SGunitedjobs
Job_Descriptions: About us PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally. Our Vision and Values We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organisations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good. We care about our World We act with Courage We Share, it’s in our DNA We choose Positivity We Deliver Awesomeness Your Profile & Role on The Project You: Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed? Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now? Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised? Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats? You Again: The Senior DevSecOps Engineer will work on acquiring, storing, governing and processing security as part of the DevOps pipeline. You will bring a vision of security solutions for the technical/engineering team in PALO IT. Finally, you will work collaboratively with other PALO IT experts in DevOps, Cloud, Digital Transformation and you would be enabling intelligence in the digital mesh of our clients and deliver a big impact to them. Automate security in a DevOps pipeline (DevSecOps). Develop solutions, install/configure/integrate IT tools and security processes within an application or organization to help improve the overall IT security posture. Set up Static and Dynamic Code Analysis tools, review the results and explain any gaps and potential impact on the team. Penetration testing and container security. Evaluate and analyze the threat, vulnerability, impact, and risk to security issues discovered from security assessments. On-premise and public cloud infrastructure security. Detect and react to cyber-attack on the public system. Write and advise on reusable, testable, efficient and secure code with the development team. Work in all phases of a rapid product development lifecycle. Document, and share knowledge on developed DevSecOps solutions. Develop and implement processes to handle releases from Development to Operations while respecting internal rules, and offering solutions for rollback. Still You: You hold a Bachelor's, Master's or Ph.D. degree in IT, Information Management and/or Computer Science. You have at least 3 years of experience in Application Security role. You have attained relevant security certifications. You are interested in designing scalable, reliable and secure software using a variety of different languages, frameworks, libraries and technical environments. You have exposure to IoT Security, knowledge of cryptography/encryption and a good understanding of networking. You are familiar with Agile Methodologies, Scrum, Kanban, and interested in learning more about Design Thinking, Lean Start-up, TDD, BDD, or XP. You are communicative with a good sense of idealism and pragmatism. You are passionate about technology and continuous learning comes naturally to you. You have excellent interpersonal, oral/written communication and cross-group collaboration skills. You are an independent thinker with a strong work ethic but also willing and able to conform to established architectural constraints. Job_Title: Senior Information Technology Project Leader - Agile Coach #SGUnitedJobs
Job_Descriptions: About Us PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Bangkok and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. YOU AGAIN: We are looking for an Agile Coach who will be responsible for driving the changes in support of the adoption of an Agile methodology across the office. You will orchestrate and lead a multi-year Agile culture transformation agenda. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders to implement changes in support of the Agile portfolio. Define and manage the Agile transformation program and champion the sustainability of best practices for Agile. Embed Agile methodology and principles in the enterprise, reflected in mindset and culture changes. Responsible for the direct oversight and coordination of the multiyear Agile transformation portfolio. Define scope, timelines, value proposition for delivery planning of projects and entire Agile transformation program. Develop strong, effective working relationships with Business Line and key stakeholders to effectively execute projects and embed Agile sustainability practices. Identify training and other change initiatives to prepare the overall organization for the adoption of an Agile methodology. Identify changes needed in central support teams and control functions to support the efficient execution of Agile projects. Work with Agile projects and central/control teams to implement the changes. Promote and ensure that individuals/teams are fully engaged in the Agile lifecycle moving from a waterfall agile (‘wagile’) to an interactive development mindset. Define key metrics and develop an approach for capturing the benefits of the Agile approach. STILL YOU: You are a Thought Leader – Must challenge status quo and grow peers thinking. Must be able to build trust and earn respect at all levels within the company. You are assertive – Must be able to ensure Agile/Scrum concepts and principles are adhered to. Must be able to be a voice of reason and authority, make the tough calls. Must be able to articulate a path forward short and long term. You believe in continuous improvement – Must continually be growing one’s craft learning new tools and techniques. You are a quick learner – Must be able to quickly gain a high-level understanding of the technical and business domains to effectively implement change. You have a lean mindset – Committed to simplicity and maximizing value while minimizing waste. You have the ability to manage a team of business analysts to administer methodology, tools, metric analysis and reporting. You have a proven track record of successfully delivering to time, cost, and quality with autonomy. You have experience with various testing techniques TDD (Test Driven Development), behavior-driven testing. You have the ability to work through and with others to drive change. You have excellent communication skills – both written and verbal and excellent listening skills. You have Technology and digital acumen and an analytical mindset combined with strategic planning and organizing skills. You have strong interpersonal skills including influencing, coaching, collaborating and team building. You have the ability to manage complexity and navigate through ambiguity. You have creativity to balance detailed problem solving while maintaining a ‘big picture’ strategic view. You have the ability to manage time and prioritize to execute on multiple initiatives within a larger portfolio. You have a Bachelor’s degree in a related field required, Master’s degree a plus. You master SCRUM, XP or Lean. You have an excellent IT culture and a real sense of Delivery. You are a strong believer in Agile Methodologies, Scrum, Kanban, TDD, BDD, XP and interested in learning more about Design Thinking, Lean Start-up. Your Role at PALO IT You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company. Job Description The Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) develops high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance Singapore’s manufacturing industry’s competitiveness, and collaborates with various MNCs, LLEs and SMEs in sectors such as precision engineering, medtech, aerospace, automotive, marine, oil & gas, semiconductor. SIMTech is looking for a highly motivated, independent and innovative quick learner with excellent interpersonal skills to join Additive Manufacturing Group. The successful candidate will have opportunities to develop himself/herself in the relevant additive manufacturing competencies, to participate in research and industry projects in AM and be involved in a dynamic research and development environment. The researchers at Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) take advantage of the state-of-the art equipment and resources, and work in a highly collaborative research environment. Successful candidate will be expected to work closely with section members and contribute in the research and development activities in the technical track of sinter based binder jet 3D printing (BJP) where he/she will be carrying out work scopes including: preparing, operating BJP printers; designing and carrying out experiments to develop consistent and reliable BJP process (printing and sintering processes) for different AM materials (e.g. processing of metal and/or ceramics) and for complex geometries; carrying out materials, mechanical properties and other related functional tests on printed parts; coordinating post-processing efforts to achieve end-to-end solutions for 3D printed components; and analysing results and reporting via presentation. Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or science (Mechanical, Material Science or equivalent). Demonstrated in-depth knowledge and strong hands-on experience in CAD based modelling, sinter based binder jet printing or powder sintering & metallurgy will be an added advantage. With 3 years’ of experience in AM in the industry field. Fresh graduate welcome to apply. Strong hands-on capabilities. Diligent and possess positive work attitude. Tenacity and energy in embracing change towards an effective and strong team work environment. Good communication, writing and presentation skills. The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. The successful candidate will have opportunities to develop himself/herself in the relevant additive manufacturing (AM) competencies and to participate in research and industry projects in AM. The researchers at SIMTech have access to the state-of-the-art equipment and resources, and will work in a highly collaborative and dynamic research and development (R&D) environment. Successful candidate will work closely with various stakeholders and contribute in the R&D activities in the technical track of powder-bed selective laser melting (SLM), where he/she will carry out work scopes including: conduct extensive AM reviews on state-of-the-art and chart research directions for high value aluminium alloy development for additive manufacturing; develop high productivity SLM process for AM materials and for complex component’s geometries; study in–depth the solidification and microstructural evolution of SLM printed alloys; map processing parameters to performance (in-depth materials, mechanical properties and other necessary functional tests); coordinate post-processing efforts to achieve end-to-end manufacturing solutions for 3D printed components; write scientific articles and participate in R&D projects with industry; and prepare proposals for competitive grant funding. Job Requirements PhD in Engineering (Material Science / Metallurgical Engineering) or equivalent. Demonstrated strong knowledge and hands-on experience in CAD based modelling and microstructural evolution analysis for SLM printed aluminium alloys will be an added advantage. With 3 years’ of experience in AM in the industry/academic field. Strong publication track record. Ability to work effectively and independently in a team. Self-motivated with positive work attitude. The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

excellent understanding of the fundamental practices, procedures, and principles of project management · Experience in Finance and Accounting in Aviation is a plus What we offer · Working in an open and cooperative environment with a motivated and friendly team · Excellent working conditions in pleasant surroundings · Good professional and personal development opportunities · Active participation in the continuous improvement of processes · An international work environment with people from around the globe · Flight and travel discount · Training and Growth opportunities Workplace & Culture Hiring_Company: LOUIS DREYFUS COMPANY FREIGHT ASIA PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: About the Company: Louis Dreyfus Company is a global merchandiser of commodities, a major asset owner and a global processor of agricultural goods. The Ocean Freight team is a dynamic and culturally diverse team, with strong values of communication and knowledge sharing. Our trading approach is at the crossroads of global key macro themes and commodities, through physical and volatile derivatives strategies. This position is an opportunity to join one of the major global dry bulk freight operators, shipping 55 million tons of cargoes per year, managing integrated activities of chartering, trading and market analysis. We offer rewarding and visible careers within a high performance organization. In a fast-paced trading-floor environment, this position requires high availability and flexibility to facilitate trades and engage with clients both internally and externally in a particular geographic region and/or vessel size segment. Occasional domestic and/or international travel to meet clients and attend shipping conventions is required (approximately three to four times per year). Responsibilities: · Develops and builds relationships with third party cargo and tonnage clients and identifies and pursues trading flows complimentary to LDC existing tonnage and cargo book Identify arbitrage opportunities and leverage in house volumes to generate profits; · Maximise each execution and be on top of operations matter to make sure best practices are in place. Liaise with the freight operations teams across the organization giving clear instructions; · Communicates with internal and external traders/clients/charterers and vessel owners/brokers to price freight; uses FFA and analyzes external price proposals to determine fair market prices; negotiates freight rates and other Charter Party contractual terms; · Utilizes in-house research and knowledge to anticipate freight market demands and trends, both short and long term, and uses own and third party cargo and tonnage to position LDC to extract value anticipating these changes. Requirements: · Bachelor or Master Degree in Maritime transportation, Economic, Business Administration, Commerce, Engineering or Mathematics. · 3 years+ of experience in drybulk and Supramax or Panamax, familiar with major cargo/routes in Indian Ocean (PG/SouthAfrica/India/Pacific) · Preference given to candidates with previous work experience in freight operator companies with existing client network · Experience in reviewing and analyzing commercial results for candidate’s business area, assessing successfulness in execution of business strategy and making future adjustments from the insights gained. · Experience in building a commercial strategy and market analysis · Experience and/or interest in analyzing balance sheets and interacting with researchers to develop indicators and other fundamental and/or quantitative tool. · Experience in / ability to interact on a daily/ongoing basis with other panamax markets to actively participate in period fleet repositioning. · Strong knowledge of freight orientated estimation and operational software IMOS Veson. · Strong understanding in performing advanced freight calculations, negotiating time charter and voyage charter party terms and arbitraging freight positions on spot and forward markets. · Relationships / contact portfolio, which can be readily accessed to enhance to our existing business.

Hiring_Company: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: As a Non-Volatile Engineering (NVEG) Product Engineer at Micron Technology Inc, you will be responsible for driving an effort to accelerate NAND development learning cycles to achieve best in class cycle time from first silicon to qualified system. Additionally, you will work with various Engineering and Development groups to ensure necessary actions are taken to meet NAND defectivity(DPM) and reliability (material assessment flow) product requirements. You will be engaged in developing, validating, characterizing, and qualifying Micron’s next generation 3D NAND memory products to power our customers’ innovation. The future of non-volatile memory and the systems that utilize the advanced technology will continue to be exciting and dynamic. Micron is seeking experienced individuals that find technical challenges engaging and invigorating. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Responsible for reviewing and ensuring Fab process conversions are assessed adequately from a product reliability perspective by recommending appropriate reliability/defectivity test flows. Responsible and accountable for reducing NAND defectivity(DPPM) and improve reliability via the material assessment flow (MAF) in order to enable qualification of world class end products (Mobile, Consumer SSD, Enterprise SSD). Perform electrical failure analysis(EFA) to solve technical problems using lab tools and techniques Develop short term counter measures in form of stresses/screens by exercising Digital and Analog Circuit, Device Physics, Process Engineering knowledge Drive Physical Failure Analysis (PFA) and Root Cause Analysis and long-term countermeasures with global organizations Optimize intrinsic performance through trim optimization through deep understanding of device operation. Collaborate with Fab, NAND Technology Development, NAND Design, NAND Product Development, System Development and Quality/Reliability team to develop solutions and ship end products Perform NAND Usage Case Modeling Evaluations (Based on Product Used Cases) Drive System Countermeasures with Firmware Teams to prevent residual failure exposure for the customer Employ data analytical skills for high volume data analysis Develop new Design for Test and Design Modes as a solution to new challenges. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor/Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering. 2-3 years of relevant work experience is an added advantage. Excellent understanding of NAND Flash Device Physics, NAND Design is required Good understanding of NAND-System Integration is required Knowledge of NAND Process Engineering is preferred Experience using schematic tools, Verilog simulation, micro probing is preferred Knowledge of Programming Languages such as Python/C/C++ is required Effective communication skills in written and spoken English Good multitasking skills and ability to set priorities in a fast moving, dynamic environment Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Self-motivation and enthusiasm

Job_Title: Senior Consultant/Manager - Supply Chain Delivery Excellence - SG
Job_Descriptions: At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and society. Whatever your aspirations, Deloitte offers you unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals. Living in a technology world that is fast-paced, gone are the days where we used to do things manually. As everything is now connected, we now have conversations about Digital Supply Network, instead of just about Supply Chain. Technology plays a key role in enabling this. There are many emerging technologies around us - too many in fact thus one of our role as consultants is to help client mix & match the right tools, to enable their ambition and to allow them to have a connected technology landscape. We want to build a team of supply chain specialists, centered on having capabilities in supply chain technologies. We will provide you with a strong and structured career development roadmap to become a Supply Chain Technology expert. So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now. Your role as a leader At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Managers/ Senior Managers /Directors across our Firm are expected to: Understand the goals of Deloitte, align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction by establishing a positive relationship with a senior stakeholders. Influence teams, and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow, develop and succeed. Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies. Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution. Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make. Work you will do In Delivery Excellence - the role will entail client facing from proposal to hands on solution delivery with a focus to manage daily delivery of projects, encompassing: 1. Project Management/Leading Delivery: Managing scope, quality & cost 2. Implementation Quality Assurance: To identify potential risks to cost 3. Project Estimating & Proposal Support: To identify root cause at sales stage and assess solutions, timeline and allocate resource, to ensure that all are kept within the estimation. 4. Delivery capability building across: Coaching members on prioritization. As a member of this team, you will take on engagements to help our clients leverage on their supply chain operation as a strategic capability and source of competitive advantage. You will use various supply chain technologies to help our clients, develop and implement strategies and operational improvement projects within their own organization, as well as within their extended supply chain network with suppliers and channel partners. You will use your creativity and knowledge to define the future of supply chain technological landscape, leveraging on the art of possible in today's digital supply chain (e.g. IoT, Mobility, Cybersecurity, Analytics). You will play a role in supporting the development of thought leadership and eminence, addressing the latest in supply chain innovation and digital supply chain. Work with a variety of high-profile clients across key industries such as Consumer Business, Process and Hi-Tech Manufacturing and Energy & Resources. Enough about us, let's talk about you You are someone with: University level degree with strong numerical, analytical and excellent story boarding skills. At least 6 years of experience in a combination of core Supply Chain skills, and consulting experience. Experience in at least one of the following function: Supply Chain Strategy, Supply Chain Planning, Manufacturing Strategy & Operations, Sourcing & Procurement, Logistics & Distribution. Ability to quickly identify business challenges and to focus on delivering results and generating business value across different Supply Chain functions. Experienced in project delivery environment, including but not limited to pace of delivery, organizational & people change management, stakeholder management. Must have strong sense of business/sales acumen and ability to write a business case. Experiences in SAP ERP will be advantageous. Demonstrated curiosity and interest in emerging supply chain technology. Excellent interpersonal, communication skills and presentation skills (including exposure to public forums / larger audiences). Travel mobility to serve regional and /or international clients. Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English) and local languages. Working experience in one or more South East Asian countries. Next Steps So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now. Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

DESCRIPTION Job summary Join the Amazon Treasury team in Singapore and help drive cash and investment decisions, manage bank relationships, ensure liquidity for global businesses, and gain operational experience in the APAC region with Global Amazon partners while working hard, having fun, and making history. A great opportunity to be a leader with a Global Company and get first-hand experience supporting cash management, financing activities, and intercompany operations in the region. Amazon is seeking a Senior Treasury Analyst to join our Treasury team in Singapore, covering the APAC region. The position will focus on our Global Cash Management activities and requires a self-starter who will work to continuously improve Treasury processes while maintaining a rigorous control environment. As part of this, one of the key responsibilities will be to support global projects for the utilization of existing and implementation of new IT applications (i.e. Treasury Management System) from the APAC region. The Amazon Treasury department offers a fast-paced, team-focused, dynamic environment that provides many challenging opportunities for developing one's financial, analytical, and Treasury skillsets as you help shape the success of APAC Treasury. The role requires working with multiple internal teams within Amazon, including those based in Seattle, Bangalore, Beijing, Luxembourg, and Singapore, from Financial Planning, Finance Operations, Tax, Accounting, and Legal, as well as external parties that include banking and financing partners, and regulators. The candidate must be able to communicate both written and verbal, complex Treasury concepts, in ways that are meaningful and useful to non-Treasury professionals. As well, focus will be on implementing and utilizing IT applications (i.e. Treasury Management System) and developing reporting that clearly communicates relevant Treasury metrics. The candidate should be proficient in treasury management systems, global liquidity management structures, cash forecasting models, global bank partnerships including evaluation of cost / mix of services, global connectivity strategies, bank relationship scorecards, leading projects to achieve team goals, and ensure full utilization of the Treasury workstation. Self motivation is a must, including working independently to partner with business teams, staying current with financial trends, and complying with industry standards and government policy. The successful candidate must have a proven track record for dealing with complexity and ambiguity in an multinational corporate Treasury team. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . BA/BS degree preferred . CTP, CPA or similar preferred . 3 to 5 years of Treasury experience with global company . Fluency in standard software - primarily MS Excel and MS Word . Global Treasury operating models and supporting centers of excellence (COE's) PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Analyze data and make decisions quickly . Excellent communication, organizational, and problem solving skills with a strong customer focus . Self-starter who is able to work independently and interface with all relevant internal teams and external business partners as needed . Comfortable supporting the implementation of new and/or utilization of existing IT applications (i.e. Treasury Management System) . Aptitude to roll up your sleeves and get things done . Ability to initiate and champion change . Demonstrated understanding of relational data and using analytics to drive solutions . Documentation of complex process flows and driving process improvements . Comfort working in a fluid and oftentimes ambiguous environment capable of making adjustments in both day-to-day and large-scale activities based on new information and developments . Proven ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects . Ability to influence and galvanize others to follow you toward a solution . Possess strong process development . Experience in identifying control deficiencies and implementing mitigating controls/processes

Job_Title: Principal, AWS Digital Policy Campaigns and External Affairs, APAC
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary Would you like to be part of a public policy team that is driving the adoption of cloud computing across Asia-Pacific Do you have the experience in public policy and with government necessary to help further advance the public policy agenda of Amazon Web Services (AWS), a leading cloud platform provider We are looking for a talented, innovative and motivated public policy professional to lead Digital Policy Campaigns and External Affairs across Asia-Pacific and Japan (APAC). Reporting to the Head of Digital Policy, APAC, the successful candidate will proactively build relationships with key internal and external stakeholders and drive strategic policy campaigns on digital policies and regulations that impact cloud adoption. You will address policy risks to the business as well as advance strategic policy opportunities and initiatives, coordinating in and across APAC and global teams. Working within the AWS APAC Public Policy team, the successful candidate will: . Develop and execute advocacy strategies related to digital policy issues across APAC. . Work collaboratively and transparently with policy-makers and regulators to ensure alignment between core business priorities and public policy goals . Manage and coordinate external advocacy efforts, outreach programs and key initiatives in concert with AWS business objectives, working closely alongside colleagues in other regions . Drive strategic third-party engagement and partnership through industry coalitions, academia, and think tanks . Facilitate high-level engagements between AWS executives and key stakeholders, including senior government officials, regulators, industry associations and alliance partners to promote and advocate the company's public policy policies. The successful candidate must be inquisitive, passionate about the possibilities of technology to transform businesses and governments, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations. The role is based in Singapore but will require some international travel when public health guidelines allow. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Basic Qualifications: . A Bachelor's degree is required in a relevant discipline (Law, Political Science, Public Policy, etc.). . 8-10 years of experience working on cybersecurity issues, either at a multinational company, think tank, or consulting/law firm and significant experience executing regulatory/policy advocacy strategies. . Written and spoken English-language fluency. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred Qualifications: . Strong knowledge of, and background in cloud computing policy developments in APAC. . An advanced degree in a relevant discipline (Law, Political Science, Public Policy, Public Affairs, etc.) is preferred. . Demonstrated experience and familiarity with digital policy and regulatory environments across multiple APAC jurisdictions. . Demonstrated ability to build and foster effective relationships and networks with others. . Demonstrated strong judgment/decision-making skills, and political acumen. . Ability to influence and strong negotiation skills. . Demonstrated ability to effectively and comfortably interact at highest corporate and government levels. . Ability to maintain highest personal levels of ethical conduct, confidentiality and integrity, with a strong professional reputation in the industry. . Self-starter with proven track record of successfully working with a wide array of functional groups and cultures across an organization.

DESCRIPTION Job summary AWS is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders, we try new things, and imagine big dreams. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious and passionate people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud technologies that enable our customers to adopt cloud based solutions. At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams within the Cloud Sales Centre (CSC). AWS is committed to be the most customer obsessed organisation on the planet. *ABOUT THE TEAM* This role is within the *APJ Area/Sub-region *CSC team. The CSC is the inside sales organisation of AWS and is focused on new customer acquisitions across APJ at scale. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically, as you collaborate with internal stakeholders across sales, operations, partner, and marketing teams, while being part of an entirely new concept at AWS. *ABOUT US* *Inclusive Team Culture* Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. *Work/Life Balance* Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfilment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. *Mentorship & Career Growth* Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. *THE ROLE* As a DG Manager, you will be leading a team of Demand Generation Reps (DGRs) focused on the early stages of the customer journey. This team will assist prospects with a specific set of existing or prospect accounts, helping them to accelerate their cloud journey. The team will invest efforts of understanding customer needs and collecting their feedback as well as identifying new opportunities in a diverse customer base. This role therefore requires the individual to be a business leader that has a background in managing campaigns, sales or business development teams. The responsibilities will also include mentoring and developing the DGRs, monitoring their performance and creating scaling mechanisms. Key job responsibilities * Hire, coach, and develop the best team of Sales Reps to deliver against your sales goals * Invest in recruiting and growing the best talent, set employees up for a great onboarding experience, and provide candid feedback for continuous development. * Drive strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer experience and continued rapid growth. * Set the tone for your team: Champion a culture of strong achievement, inclusiveness, collaboration, creativity, and accountability while being a champion for your team's career development * Build and drive territory strategy and priorities and communicate them clearly with your team. Continuously optimize our sales methodology and share ideas to improve efficiency and focus, enable greater scale, and yield better results. * Partner with cross-functional teams to maximize results (partner, field sales, solutions architects, marketing, specialists, etc.). * Collaborate with Sales Enablement and People Operations to develop and execute individual and group training opportunities, identify development needs, and implement process improvement initiatives. * Use metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers. You'll also act as an evangelist in the wider community. This includes taking part in educating and sharing best practices. You won't just want to be part of an industry movement you'll want to be leading it. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS * 5+ years of related sales or business development experience * 3+ years in team management positions * Proven track record of metrics and quota attainment * Experience with CRM * Analytical skills using data to leverage and build strategic operating plans PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS * Record of success in an outbound or inbound sales or prospecting role in B2B * environments, preferably in a solution-sales / technology-related environment. * Experience working with, and/or having knowledge of business technology and or cloud computing * Skilled in prospecting techniques What if I'm not an expert in all qualifications That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning and are curious. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry today.

About us Being a pivotal role in the concept to production of a Dyson Designed Cell puts the Development team at the heart of this exciting journey. The team will translate early concept directions into fully developed, optimised & validated solutions to make at high volume for the next generation of Dyson products.About the role Design and iterate on cathode formulations to determine formulation-performance correlated factors, optimize the performance of the cell made in cell chemistry platform. Perform hands-on experiment to demonstrate the function of cathode formulation with solid electrochemical and material basis. Visualize your ideas in design of experiment (DoE) and develop and invent effective methodologies for result analysis to support the proof of your hypothesis. Investigate correlation in a stream of material process parameter – material properties – performance in a cell, provide a perspective of new materials introduction and contribute to smooth transition of incubated technologies into mass production. Establish effective collaboration across teams on root cause/FMEA analyses to identify and mitigate under performance in the full-cell and scale up process. Build small-scale prototype cells to measure key metrics and demonstrate technology developments. About you Minimum 2 years' experience in cathode material development for energy storage including material test, evaluation and utilisation. Degree or diploma in materials science, materials engineering, chemical engineering, or related disciplines. Prerequisite to have hands-on laboratory experience in electrochemical testing (e.g. voltammetry, impedance spectroscopy, titration techniques, battery cell cycling) and/or cell fabrication, to support pilot line cell tests. Strong working knowledge of material chemistry, electrochemistry and problem-solving competence. Experience with cell development process and understanding of essential outputs of each development stage is advantageous. Have unbiased view and high ethical standard towards data analysis and reporting. Desire to learn from new challenges, problem solving, and communication skills to work within a highly interactive and experienced team. Comfortable with a “hands-on” approach to getting things done. Benefits Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.#LI-DYSON Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity. About Us Dyson organises its business into product Categories, such as Floorcare, Environmental Care and Haircare. Category finance teams work as finance business partners for Category leadership. We support development and delivery of Dyson’s financial plans by providing financial control and business partnering throughout the product lifecycle: design->development->launch->sale->end of life. This involves product focused commercial financial planning and analysis, the management of business cases for Research, Design & Development (RDD) projects, and planning and control of Category RDD & Operations budgets.About the Role The role holder has global responsibility for the planning, analysis and control of RDD Opex budgets and manufacturing Capex budgets for Environmental Care and Expansion Category business units and will report into the Head of Category Finance. The purpose of the role is to ensure the Environmental Care and Expansion Categories have effective financial planning and spend control across global RDD and Manufacturing capex budgets. The role holder will also be expected to provide finance leadership on cross-functional projects related to the role scope and to contribute to/lead finance training for non-finance colleagues. Primary role duties Working with Category leadership teams, lead development of budgets/Latest Estimates (LEs) for Environmental Care and Expansion Categories that cover RDD expenditure and manufacturing capital expenditure. Provide analysis and insight into organisational investment performance compared to budget. Identify opportunities and actions to optimise spend and influence organisational planning to meet relevant financial targets. Manage the financial control framework for relevant budgets. Secondary/additional role duties Provide finance leadership on relevant cross-functional projects. Examples of recent projects include managing the exit from a key contract manufacturer and a product line shut down decision financial analysis. Lead and contribute to organisational financial acumen through identifying finance knowledge requirements of non-finance stakeholders and providing access to relevant training.About You Previous work experience You should be able to provide previous examples of using financial information to support decision making by non-finance stakeholders. You should have awareness of the financial systems environment - e.g. purchasing, enterprise resource planning & financial consolidation systems - in medium-large sized organisations. The role does not involve detailed work in financial systems but the role holder is expected to understand and analyse data from a range of systems. Ideally, you should be able to demonstrate experience of budget planning and control in a complex organisation.   Specific technical qualifications/exposure A globally recognised professional accounting qualification, e.g. ACA, ACCA, CIMA, CPA etc. Excellent analytical ability and proficiency with Microsoft Excel. Behaviours necessary for success Curiosity: interest in Dyson’s overall business and, specifically, new product design and development. Communications & Influence: the ability to communicate complex financial information simply, with impact, to non-financial stakeholders. Collaboration: the ability to build and sustain relationships with stakeholders with different backgrounds, seniorities and personalities to effectively balance Dyson’s finance and product innovation objectives. Resilience & Independence: ability to be calm and balance different organisational requirements in difficult and sensitive situations. Benefits Dyson monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and pension contributions. Beyond that, you’ll also enjoy a profit-related bonus, generous leave and life insurance. But financial benefits are only the start of a Dyson career. Rapid professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, flexible working hours, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to creativity, innovation and ambition. #LI-DYSON  Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity. Job Description OUR CLIENT Our client is a family office investing in sustainable and responsible businesses in Asia. They are highly purposeful and committed to green financing, mainly investing from Series C to buy out as a growth capital fund. Reporting to the Head of Direct investment, we are looking for a Senior Investment Manager. The Investment strategy aims to protect capital and create long-term value for all stakeholders to accelerate the transition to a sustainable economy. ROLE MISSION As Investment Manager, you are a senior member of a small and agile investment team reporting to the Head of Direct investments. The successful candidate will have experience of the complete investment cycle, covering transaction sourcing and execution and portfolio management (including growth and exit). You will manage the existing regional portfolio, develop origination selectively, execute transactions and assume responsibility for portfolio activities in the region. You will participate in developing the 10-year group fund management and deployment strategy. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES •       Lead the the Asian/Pacific activities and manage a high performance 'regional' virtual team, including executive management members of portfolio companies. •       Participate in the development of the investment strategy of the group and activities, with a focus on Asia and ensuring seamless integration and coordination across both regions. •       In due time, build, train and mentor the team, and ensure long term succession plans. •       Deliver business performance (milestones and targets), and manage mature stakeholder communication with the team and the larger family office. •       Actively manage portfolio companies through o   Development and execution of growth strategies by identification and development of new markets, new products, partnerships, and acquisitions. o   Development and implementation of strategic initiatives such as debt and equity financing, senior management selection, board construction. o   Ongoing monitoring and relationship management, including monthly/quarterly operational and financial performance reviews •       Originate deals and leverage external/junior resources in developing research and completing due diligence. •       Deliver sector research on new areas of investment and impact interest. IDEAL TALENT Experience in private equity investing supported by a background in corporate finance and/or management consulting; track record in operational management, development of value creation strategies and the management of investment exits. Maturity, business acumen and experience operating at the board and executive management level of portfolio businesses. Knowledge of active portfolio management in a growth equity/buy-out strategy. Experience of the complete investment cycle from deal origination, commercial negotiation, due diligence, preparation and presentation of investment papers at the Investment Committee and closing. Take ownership. Fully autonomous with little or no supervision. Manage and lead change. Has been responsible for managing a virtual or hierarchal team. Able to lead teams working on complex issues, keep morale high & develop people. Communicate effectively and with impact. Generate a network of contacts at senior level. A minimum of 10 years career experience, with more than 4 in a direct investment setting. Ideally a technology/industrial background combined with a further business qualification. Strongly motivated by the family investment strategy. WeLinkTalent | Executive Recruitment WE LINK THE RIGHT TALENT TO THE RIGHT OPPORTUNITY • Who are we? Job Description The jobholder reports to the Trading Operations General Manager of the Singapore office and works in liaison with the trading operations in Geneva and Dubai, under the local supervision of the Managing Director of the Singapore office. The jobholder will be assigned to the Fuel Oil desk. Job Dimensions: International activity area on a definite geographical zone, in a team of products trading operators, within which the jobholder is the main contact between counterparts and the group for contracts execution. Being assigned in the Fuel Oil desk, the job holder will also focus on terminal storage and blending optimization. Activities: In the frame of internal procedures, formalizing the Trading negotiations by drafting and sending of commercial contracts, having controlled the coherence and the feasibility of the negotiated issues. It implies a good knowledge of legal, financial and operational terms governing this type of contract. Evaluating/estimating all the costs derived from a transaction and communicating all operational data having a financial impact on Trading results (prices, hedges, freight, currency). Guaranteeing a satisfactory management of storage, blending and processing contracts (quantities /qualities /financial exposure). Coordinating logistics of all loadings/unloadings by sea and/or overland and avoiding/minimizing the various hazards/mishaps. Liaising with M\u0026amp;S entities to secure and optimize the supply of our TotalEnergies affiliates throughout East Africa , Asia, Far East-Pacific. Following up the vessels chartered by the Group (spot, COA or T/C) and optimizing, in connection with Trading/Shipping, the rotations and loading plans. Making sure that the vetting procedures for seagoing vessels and barges are respected (Group rule CR-GR-HSE-416). Nominating the service providers essential to the realization of the contracts (independent inspectors/agents) and controlling the accuracy and consistency of the obtained results. Obtaining financial guarantees from counterparts, controlling and/or amending them before cargo loading/unloading, in connection with the Credit department. Identifying the cause for the encountered operational problems and activating the procedures necessary to their solution in coordination with all involved participants (immediate superior/Trading/Legal/Insurers/etc), at minimal costs and consequences to the Group. Liaising with Loss Control to handle Quantitative and qualitative issues. Invoicing customers and paying our suppliers’/service providers’ invoices. Securing, in coordination with Financial Department (Treasury, Credit, Financial Control, Accounting), the recovery of funds due (invoicing late payment interests). Objectives: The jobholder will ensure proper execution of contracts. The jobholder is responsible for resorting to all required means to achieve the result anticipated by Trading, always in strict compliance with T\u0026amp;S and Group procedures and rules. The jobholder is autonomous in his decisions and has entire responsibility of operational means. Within the framework of Customers relationships and given the financial and political stakes, the jobholder optimizes the logistic and commercial flows allowing the complete satisfaction of customers. Job Responsibilities: Lead Electrical & Instrument Engineer. Assists Project Manager in project interfaces and resolving issues with Customers. Leads technical meetings with Customers and End-Users. Familiar with Hazardous area classification and installation requirement - ATEX, IEC, NEC standards etc. Good personality, interpersonal savvy, communication skills, self-motivated. Customer focused and results driven. Date: 10-Feb-2022 Location: Singapore, SG, 118222 Company: Lloyds Register About Nettitude Nettitude is a LRQA Company. We’ve been around since 2003 and our focus has always been on excellence in cyber security. We have teams that offer world class services in red teaming, penetration testing, threat intelligence, research and development, detection and response, governance, risk, and compliance, and plenty more. Our business is global and so are our clients. We work closely with central banks, central and local government, critical national infrastructure, large retailers, and plenty more besides! We’re an award winning provider of cyber security services and we’re are at a very exciting stage of development. We are looking for the right people to join us as we embrace the challenges thrown up by the advancements within the IT industry and within the threats faced. Nettitude will be at the forefront of this arena and we want to seek the right people to join the team and make it happen. The role Our senior security consultants are responsible for leading and delivering their own penetration testing security engagements with our clients.  This includes the full lifecycle of an engagement from kick off call, testing, report creation, report delivery to debrief.  As a senior consultant, we are keen for you to shadow new starters, as well supporting the VP of APAC with more complex client engagements. In your role you will: Deliver penetration testing and other related security activities for medium and large and enterprise clients.  These security activities will include performing engagement kick off calls, wash up calls, email responses and debrief for each assigned client engagement. Write full and thorough reports for each engagement that show rapid and constant improvement, incorporating feedback from quality reviews. Assist in Security Testing related presales activities, providing technical assessment of scope, principal security concerns and testing methodology to Account Manager. Provide pre sales support to the account management team. Develop client relationships and ensure Nettitude delivers professional consultative style engagements at all times When requested, provide technical analysis of current IT Security related events, especially for the purpose of media coverage. Be a continuous learner, keeping up to date on a wide variety of IT Security related skills and industry knowledge. Mentor more junior security consultants where appropriate and/or requested. Key skills There is no fixed set of skills required to be a successful candidate. However, the more of the following attributes you can demonstrate to us, the more likely you will be to end up with a job offer. Penetration testing experience. While professional penetration testing experience is preferred, in some cases we can accept individuals who have worked in related cyber security professions, dependant on aptitude and thirst for knowledge. Cloud penetration testing skills are a big plus. You love getting involved in deep technical challenges, while at the same time being able to abstract and explain the most complex issues to a C level exec. In depth knowledge and understanding of applications and networking. An ability to teach and mentor other members of the team is a distinct advantage; it’s part of what makes us Nettitude! Exploit creation, scripting and reverse engineering are a distinct advantage. You code open source tools, contribute to security blogs, and participate in CTFs. A thirst for knowledge and a constant desire to push yourself to the max. There are no formal requirements for any qualifications or certifications. We’re not looking for badge collectors; we look far deeper than that. However, one or more of the following will serve as a distinct advantage. A BSc degree (or equivalent) in a technical discipline. CREST Registered Tester (CRT) or CREST Certified Tester (CCT). OSCP OSCE or GIAC and other industry recognized certifications will also be well received. CCSK / CCSP / CISSP AWS Security Specialty / Azure AZ-500 Why should you work with us? We have industry leading levels of employee retention, and for good reason; we’re the kind of place that no one wants to leave! We push ourselves to the max, so if you’re the kind of person who loves deep technical challenges and a fantastic work environment, we welcome your interest.  Please do visit our website to understand more about how we develop our people, work on cutting edge engagement and offer multiple career progression paths. What we offer: Nettitude is very focused on empowering its employees.  This is a home-based role and we offer you an exciting working environment with intellectual challenges, responsibility and high level client interaction. An attractive remuneration package will be provided. Apply? Are you interested in this job? Apply now via the ‘apply’ button and upload your C.V. and cover letter Job Segment: Engineer, Testing, Open Source, R&D, Engineering, Research, Technology

Job_Title: Infrastructure - Specialist Advisor - Anti-Financial Crime - Sanctions and Embargoes Officer - Assistant Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Infrastructure - Specialist Advisor - Anti-Financial Crime - Sanctions and Embargoes Officer - Assistant Vice President Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: Regulation, Compliance and Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) protects the integrity and reputation of Deutsche Bank. It manages the Bank’s risks and help to avert unintentional rule breaches and conflicts of interest. At the same time, we also advise the bank on ethical conduct and governance issues and keep the bank up to date on regulatory and political challenges. As the Sanctions and Embargoes Officer, you will join the APAC Sanctions Transaction Review Desk. The APAC Sanctions Transaction Review Desk is responsible for the third-level review and decision-taking on escalated transaction messages from Deutsche Bank’s transaction filtering process in alignment with applicable sanctions regulations, and internal sanctions policies and procedures. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Supporting the Regional Head of Sanctions & Embargoes in advising business and infrastructure units on sanctions-related queries on clients, transactions, screening alerts and/or deals (including cash management, payments, corporate finance, and trade finance products and services) in alignment with Group sanctions policies Conducting and/or reviewing sanctions-related investigations on escalated transactions or cases for further escalation to Group Sanctions & Embargoes Assist in the implementation of Sanction Target Operating Model (TOM) within APAC in relation to level 3 escalations for transaction filtering and sanctions related name list screening processes. Investigate and report any sanctions breaches concerning transactions in the region to the Group Sanctions Breach Team. Drafting of regional sanctions-related processes and procedures, if necessary Monitoring, and keeping the relevant business and infrastructure units and APAC locations informed on international and regional sanctions developments that may have regional impact to the Bank’s global or APAC operations Conduct of training or briefing sessions to business and infrastructure units within the APAC region Participation in global and regional calls to update on regional developments and issues may be required Perform any applicable reporting obligations to the competent authorities in relation to transaction handling, or other sanctions policy issues as required Assist the region in formulating consistent responses to sanctions-related questions and findings in audits and inspections Reviewing of USD transactions as and when required after APAC hours Support/participate in working groups for globally driven projects that will have an operational impact for APAC locations in the transaction filtering or name list screening space. Identification / providing feedback on any sanctions relevant gaps or efficiency opportunities in existing processes and addressing these with relevant stakeholders. Engage Group Sanctions and/or other Regional Sanctions teams on relevant sanctions-related topics which have an operational impact on the transaction filtering process in the APAC region. Your skills and experience: 5+ years of relevant experience including in past investigation / financial crime intelligence, particularly focusing on AML Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience Knowledge of Sanctions laws and regulations applicable in APAC as well as international programs of the United States, European Union and United Nations in order to provide overall legal guidance on Sanctions risk issues Sound knowledge of the banking industry and the respective product spectrum of an international Corporate and Investment Bank Flexible, able to address compliance and business demands in a constantly changing international legal and regulatory environment Ability to work both independently and as part of a team within the Sanctions function Prepared to take sound decisions on the basis of facts and in consideration of all internal and external regulatory requirements and expectations A strong communicator across all levels in a multi-national environment and able to provide guidance for the various stakeholders within the Bank An excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing CAMS / CGSS certification will be a plus How we’ll support you: Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network, click here to see what we do Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.
